WI9Ozf6pTr2XVteaULkLGA.text: It looks a little weird on the outside, but take a risk and go here. You won't regret it. The food is so good and cheap.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Everything is finished.
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nothing left. Even the chips and salsa.

xmlHbDGAEmaadOnfhM109g.text: Dammit, I really really wanted to like this place, and I still do want to, but it just didn't hit the mark for me.   The restaurant is clean and neat, and the service was good. We were the only table in the entire restaurant for a good while before a few other tables shuffled in. We ordered the enchiladas with beef, pork AND chicken, a spicy pork burrito, beef bulgogi flautas, and kim chi fried rice. Everything was JUST okay, but I didn't get the fusion part at all. Other than the fried rice, everything tasted just plain Mexican to me, and not exceptional Mexican either. I didn't get the Korean fusion in any of our dishes at all.  In addition, all of the meat in the enchiladas tasted the same. I couldn't tell the difference between the pork and chicken at all, not even by looking at it.   The kimchi fried rice was the best out of everything we ordered. It was flavorful with a hint of kimchi and the fried egg on top was a great touch.   Sadly, the meal was extremely forgettable and I probably won't be returning. :(

FKgiAJXJ9-R2XALOng2Zag.text: WHO: To all of you Korean food wrapped in tortilla goodness lovers!  WHEN: I'm not too sure when they open, but I do know they close at 9pm.  WHERE: North Decatur, sooooo far but soooo good! =/  WHAT: It all began one night at about 8pm. My friend and I were thinking of a new food place to try. This one suddenly popped in my head (not knowing where it was even located), I called to see if they were still open, turned on GPS, and then realized how far we were supposed to travel (we were coming from the Southwest side of town)... We ended up getting there around 840pm.. I pretty much felt bad bec I saw they were closing and 9pm... Yes, I was that customer... lol  When we entered, there was a Korean lady who greeted us (I think she was one of the owners). I appologized about coming in and ordering super late. She said it was just fine, with a smile! =) We then looked through the menu, and I wanted everything!! She helped us choose and we ended up getting...  -The Fusion burrito: which consisted of spicy pork & kimchi wrapped in a burrito. Sooooo good -Pork belly musubi: which was the special going on at the moment. Sooooo good!!  We were then greeted happily & we went on our merry ways... I love that place! I need to go back ASAP. Like NOW!!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly musubi for a limited time!
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy pork burrito!!

8IAnzh4m4xykuu54nIhpNw.text: Went to KoMex for the first time for my friends birthday...one word DELICIOUS. Once my friend mentioned the place I checked it on yelp and the ratings were 4 to 5 stars so I was pretty excited to check the place out and try the food.   For starters we ordered the bulgogi fries and nachos both half orders. Beef bulgogi kimchi fried rice, combo fried rice, spam musubi that we all shared. The fries were worth trying, as for the nachos they were good as well. But if I had to pick between the two to try its would definitely be the fries. The kimchi fried rice was delicious, especially being a kimchi lover. The combo fried rice came with veggies, beef, and shrimp which was good.   If you haven't been here you definitely have to try this spot out, worth spending some bucks on.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BR18azSo9RorxmPI-WgYCw.text: So they've eliminated a few menu itms, and raised prices just a touch in hopes of branching off with other locations!! YAY!  So we hadn't been here in a while, the last time we were here, the service provided by the owner. I especially can't stand when small shop owners refuse to accommodate for their guests, but there was a total turnaround this time.  We 1 bulgolgi lettuce wrap and 1 in corn each as well as the combination fried rice (with pork instead of shrimp) and I also decided to try the wonton soup.. in the brink of summer..   WHY AREN'T YOU ALL ORDERING THE WONTON SOUP?! The broth was phenomenal, the wontons were huge and full of delicious pork. I'm a wonton soup connoisseur, and this was some of the best I'd ever had in the valley! After 2 spoonfuls of soup, I look up at Jason and tell him this was going to be a winter fave.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination fried rice- no chicken
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef lettuce wrap

2aB0rI_OMow5MO79iXhkXA.text: Straight out of the car from Salt Lake City. We didn't stop at the hotel. We didn't drive the strip. We set the GPS coordinates for Komex and as road-weary travelers, peeled ourselves out of the car and ambled in to the restaurant.  We don't get much (read:any) Korean-Mexican fusion in Salt Lake, so I was really looking forward to seeing what exactly it was. The food around us smelled terrific, and after eating right for days on end, it was time to splurge. Spend those calories!  So what does a fella order when he wants to taste around? The bulgogi burrito, of course. Oh, and then a couple of tacos as an add-on to taste the other meats. One dak-gogi and one daeji-gogi, just to be safe.   It wasn't pretty the way I unhinged my jaw and swallowed that whole burrito. But it wa oh-so-delicious. The side of kimchi made all the difference in the world, too. Beautiful, baby! And the tacos were tasty as well. I favored the pork over the chicken, but really--it was all unique and bursting with new flavors.  I also got to sample the vegetarian noodles which had a slightly smoky flavor and were served in an approximate 47lb. mound. Portions are generous here, and there's plenty o' bang for not hardly a buck.

W2gTCjB8UEGtCdTptZpojA.text: This place is bomb.  The flavors are great and I love their hot sauces.  The calamari taco was delicious.  The spam kim Chee fried rice was super tasty- a little on the mushy side.  I may come back tomorrow before I leave this town for tacos.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The hot sauces were delicious.  I especially love the red chili one with cilantro.
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spam kim chee fried rice- good flavors and all but a little mushy.
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The freebie with a meal.

vEKvklceRhx-ywDbnQZxig.text: Excellent fusion for a cheap price. I had the bulgogi nachos (get the bigger size, only $2 more), which were fantastic. We also tried the Calimari tacos and the pork belly tacos, both of which had excellent toppings and were very tasty.   I personally liked the pork belly ones more but my friend liked the calimari.   All in all, great food and great value for a very low price. I would go back here again.

0U0lIFRc-VaApoTssAVygw.text: This review is totally biased. I love both Korean and Mexican food but the two together are TERRIBLE. The best dish solely was just the bulgogi and steamed veggies. I won't return. Service was fine, slow too cook food. Don't come if your in a hurry.

C2cRRP91AuS3h2kt-C0f4g.text: Hmm Komex is still awesome, but they have changed up a few things which really put the place over the top since I last stopped by.  Came by a few days ago with Pratik W. and noticed that the whole place looked different. They eliminated some booths and opened the place up which is good!.  But sadly they have eliminated the Yelp check in offer for the free wontons. Really bummed me out - show love to your Yelp fans!  Also, one of things which I loved which was the free bottled water has now been replaced by tap water. They used to serve water in a glass straight from one of those small Costco water bottles, now its tap. I understand that it may have been costly but tap water sucks and they could have at least gotten a Brita as some people do expect this.  But of course the food is still awesome. Great fusion you can't get anywhere else!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi fries!

i7f6FWZMut1nKzFYiQx0lw.text: Why the change in stars?  I think the food got better than the last time I was here...maybe it is in my head...dunno.  Either way, I ordered the bulgogi fries again, but this time without the kim chi.  I love kim chi, but these were WAY better without the KC...  Went with a bulgogi burrito...WAY better than the tacos IMO.  I had a few tacos this time, as well as remembering last time, and it is way better in the burrito fashion to me.  I also tried some fish tacos...the regular fish taco was ok, not bad at all, but I prob won't order it again.  However, the calamari taco comes with a different sauce, and it was super good.  Very tender meat, and the sauce pulls it all together.  Bravo!  I'll be back again :)

O2XtmE7edbULaym-J-OZ0A.text: You come across a place called "KoMex fusion"....Dazed? Confused? Mystified? Let me clear this up for you, KoMex fusion is Korean, Mexican, Chinese and American food all smashed together. Not clear enough? Well, then it is what everyone says it is, freakin awesome. It's quite a trek from the strip, so be prepared to hop on the freeway, but trust me, you will save much more money on food so the extra gas will be more than paid for. My family of four tried many different dishes, we all ordered drinks and our bill was $20. I'm not even joking. The problems with KoMex is that it is not in the best area and it is super small. There is often a line out the door. I suggest you go at off times, try everything and tip heavy (they work their butts off here).

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef fusion tacos

SwjcwrPnDgDl-oruLDpr8A.text: Fuckin delicious! Great prices for the portions and the food was exactly what we needed....meat and carbs.

reKcRO1tE8KCbKmClKL6EQ.text: Ordered the bulgogi fries and kimchi fried rice, and was not that impressed. Plus, my husband got sick after eating it and was in the bathroom the rest of the night.  Also, it's located in a sketchy shopping center. We're willing to give it another try because I love Asian fusion.. but probably not anytime soon.

n00Jap_uQZORTUyeVEDH1Q.text: Ok honestly I had seen this place for a long time and I was always curious to check it out and I must say WOW!!! Everything was awesome from the service and staff down to the comp chips and salsa. This place is def a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super delish! New fav!!!

ZMNfblESOg7RL9FaT6sXSA.text: Let me suggest you spend your money else where. My fellow employees and I had been long time patrons of this establishment until today. Due to our restricted lunch time we placed an order in advance to eat in the establishment. When we arrived the food was packed to go and we all paid for our meals. We explained that we were going to stay and eat and immediately received attitude. Let me say this...in our party there was a Hispanic male, white woman and two black women. The male in our party asked if we could have chips (which are complimentary for dine-in). The gentlemen (owner) behind the counter proceed to yell and state to the Hispanic male in our party that this was not Taco Bell and he couldn't have things his way....very racists. Then he proceeded to call him an asshole and walk up on him yelling in his face. Let's say it was really close to becoming physical. Thankfully there was a cop in the establishment who deescalated the situation. We will make sure to pass the word on in our business so they understand the type of people who own and work for this restaurant. Dont support this business. I work for an organization that is well over 4000 employees and I train new employees every year. There have numerous occasions I have been asked what was a great place to eat and I would refer them to this establishment but not any longer. Sad to believe racism, prejudice and terrible service still exist to this day.

wEd8d3kEQ23pYtCytiTvTw.text: My friend took me here before we went to watch a movie--we patiently waited for our food with that bowl of fried chips that they give out!   I wasn't sure about Korean and Mexican food being blended until I had that Fusion Chimichanga..omg. It was messy and delicious and awesome! My friend vacuumed her meal right up! My other friend had the Kimchi Fried Rice..holy crap was that excellent.   Most interesting mix of food I've ever had in my life. I would recommend this place a million times!

DQzduktl4eLDOJmSFMJMyA.text: I see why this place is so popular, the idea of Korean food and Mexican mixed into one seems weird, but once you try there taco's! Yummy!

HO6B-NtdIACKWsy7JEBERg.text: This place is amazing, We had the Fusion Tacos and the Fusion Burrito Great Flavor combinations. They definitely know what they're doing, the server/owner is very welcoming and shows his appreciation to every single customer that walks in.  You Must Try!!!!!!

aeZv5f9VhEtecHweD5Gr5Q.text: AMAZING!!!! I had the bulgogi fries and another dish I was so full but couldnt stop eating..will be going back for sure!!

vHvLzqmbII9nUzgCF0MnZg.text: This little hole-in-the-wall place is amazing. The bulgogi beef tacos are so good inside your mouth. Don't miss out!

FEFcQ8Jp-P2QzlzGKkXbPA.text: I have been wanting to try this place.  I've read all about it on Yelp.  My girlfriend has turned me on to Korean cuisine.  I like Mexican cuisine, but she does not.  So, I had to rope my father into going with me.  Komex is conveniently located off the 95 at Decatur.  Just head North on Decatur and look for it on the left just before Washington.  There is not enough parking for that shopping center.  The decor is typical mom and pop, not super fancy, but it is clean.  Mostly booths.  Have a seat and a server will come by soon.  The place is small, perhaps six or eight booths/tables.  We ordered two Mexican sodas: one mandarin orange and the other lime.  They came in bottles and they provided glasses with ice and straws.  I tried both flavors and liked both.  The carbonation was strong.  The server brought out complimentary chips, saIsa, and guacamole.  The chips were more like fried pitas.  They seemed fresh, but were cold.  The salsa was very flavorful.  The guacamole was ordinary, but how many other places give you guacamole for free?  So, I'm not complaining.  If you check in on Yelp you get a free order of fried wontons.  I showed our server.  I went to the bathroom and was disgusted by the smell (the only unpleasant part of my experience at Komex).  The fried wontons were crispy, hearty, and flavorful.  Not overly greasy.  The dipping sauce was really tasty, kind of sweet and spicy hot at the same time.  We ordered two fusion tacos (one beef and the other chicken), bulgogi burrito, and pork torta.  The food all came out at different times, which I did not mind.  There were only two people working the front-of-house and the place was full (was lunch time).  Everything was flavorful.  I could taste the Korean and the Mexican and it worked.  The burrito and torta were huge portions.  Our server brought out some sauces, which were all good.  Upon finishing our server brought out a complimentary dessert, which was an orange sliced in half and the pieces cut out and then put back in.  Two little plastic swords were stuck in two of the slices.  Really nice touch.  Usually I skip dessert after eating so much food, but I told myself I had to eat my daily allowance for fruit and enjoyed it.  It was fresh.  Fortune cookies came with the bill.  Torta $5.99; burrito $4.99; tacos $1.29 each; sodas $1.29 each; wontons free with Yelp check in; fortune cookies free; orange free; and chips, salsa, & guacamole free.  The total bill was under $18 and we were stuffed.  Our server was super friendly and helpful.  It was totally busy, but we ate and got back to work within an hour.  This place gets five stars all the way "Woohoo!  As good as it gets!"

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spam musubi
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fusion chimichanga
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fusion taco (beef)

Oa18K7iTsiWtDL-t5ZEjvg.text: The best tacos! Pork belly delicious. The shrimp flour taco also very good. Get the kimchi. Service excellent. Worth the trip from New York.

z12HWUwOAJ_ITG-RD53t1w.text: I'm here anytime 'm in Las Vegas.  Excellent stuff here -- good as the korean tacos out in SoCal. The tacos and the Bulgogi fries are highlights, but the burrito with Kimchi is awesome too. Weird thing:  You have to request Kimchi on anything if you want it.  You do.

W56wZI5a0vaH6cFMhxAyTA.text: Not the nicest atmosphere but the food rocks!  Had the tacos.  They were all very good and very reasonably priced

9tnp8CtMnqTe-Sf8NMxNqw.text: In my head, the fusion of Mexican & Korean didn't quite click, but was I ever wrong!  This food is fabulous, and we will definitely go back when back in the area. We had a fish taco, a calamari taco, and the Bulgogi Nachos - oh my!

czfklp-5gSGInuXjqMlz9w.text: I live all the way on the other side of town but always have to make the trip to eat here at least once a month. The menu has a wide variety of food from mexican to korean. I love both kinds of food so i think it's a genius fusion! They give everybody free chips and salsa in the beginning of the meal, and usually give orange slices at the end. The one thing i always have to order is the bulgogi fried rice. It's delicious and comes in a huge portion! I also always try to order something new and so far, i haven't ordered anything i didnt like. Luckily, everything is so cheap here, i dont feel guilty for ordering a bunch of stuff! Usually when a place has good food for cheap prices, the staff isn't so great... But not this place! The workers are always friendly and attentive, even when they're busy with every single table filled and more people waiting at the door!   I highly suggest this place. It does not disappoint!

Q2dKvmYj02sWxU4QRCK49w.text: So good! We have been here three times and have had excellent service every time. We love the chips and salsa they give you when you sit down. All the tacos and burritos we have tried so far have been delishious. The kimchi that can be added to the burrito is excellent also.

_ROYp6MwUiJLQD6YDzbkmg.text: My hubby and I loved this place. The bulgogi fried rice was awesome.  Since we moved to the area we have been searching for good beef bulgogi.  We finally found it here.   The tacos, burritos and fries were also fantastic.  It is definitely worth the trip to that part of town.  We will be back many, many times.

FrbOxSfMuxc_AbSYyLJTYQ.text: I dont think i can put into words how much i enjoyed there food here! The bulgogi burrito w/kim chee was amazing. This place has such good prices and for the amount of food you receive you wont be disappointed but im sure youll be going back for more. The Korean musubi was another thing i was able to try and even that, such a simple dish but made with a twist, so ono! My co worker got the Mongolian beef stir fry with fried rice and the plate was also pretty huge and the taste was definitely a winner! Theres alot of free parking and its not hard to find. So next time your in the area definitely stop in at KoMex!!!

8PFi1-RxbD0aRzfRB2QrJw.text: Bomb diggity! Vegas secret no more! I'm telling everyone. This place is a great idea and the flavors blend very well. I love the fusion between the Mexican dishes with the Korean flavors. It seems like it was starting to get packed when we were about to leave. On top of being well attended too, and extra food choices, the meal was rather inexpensive! Bonus all around. KoMex, you will be a stop while I'm in Vegas again. Thank you.

hfHOFj1JHZkmmzG0KSGcwg.text: I wasn't really sure how I would feel about a mexican/korean fusion joint but I have to admit I was pleasantly surprised. This place really exceled at the fusion tacos, especially the bulgogi (beef) tacos which really went well together. Also I was really impressed by the fried rice as well. The only down side was the spicy pork was a bit of a dissapointment, not that it was bad, but I have had better elsewhere. Staff was nice and friendly and the price was very reasonably as well.

DioEJ1Qx7OkMzKZmNFv6hQ.text: Korean and Mexican on the same plate, in the same tortilla wrapper??... Somehow it works, and it works really well here. The ingredients are really fresh and the menu is really creative. There are "standard" Mexican, Chinese, and Korean items for those not brave enough to go with a bulgogi tostada, but the whole point of trying this place is to dive in and go for it. We even took our plain-eating American friend, who had never eaten Korean food, and she finished the entire plate of bulgogi, rice and kimchi (she's tiny and the portion is huge). Try several things to share, but beware, the portions are really huge, so ask for half size.  The dining area's pretty small so go at off-times if you can. Not the prettiest neighborhood but we never felt unsafe. It's in the corner of a strip mall, but no parking issues. We drove there twice from the Strip and it was totally worth it, definitely check it out!

ZXXw_jRtO2IJEUOFIQx7vg.text: The food is really really good, and cheap. The only problem is now they have more business then they can handle. I've been twice one for lunch for work I had to take a 2 hour lunch because I waited an hour for my food, and we all got our food at different times. Second I brought my girl up there cause the food was so good and we had to wait 40 min just to get the food and the order was wrong and she didn't want to wait for it to be corrected. Very frustrating but both times what I ate was so so good.

Yc6uGC649yyWND2RRs0f5A.text: Apparently the owner listened to guys like H.K.L. and decided she needed to raise her prices. Maybe I was just spoiled on her really low prices but now her prices are about average and it takes the wow factor out of it for me. I loved the fact that I could come and order a couple of entrees for 10 bucks. Now that time has passed. The real turn off was finding a hair in my chips. I took them back up to the owner and she apologized and offered to bring me another basket. At that point I just paid the bill and left. I really loved Komex as you can tell from my previous reviews. At this point I just feel like the success has turned to greed and I won't be back.

b0VpsQJ3DViVj0J1F9usew.text: Great idea for Korea/Mexican fusion.  Korean burrito tastes great along with the korean tacos.  I gave them 3 stars because service is so-so.  I've been here multiple times and I am never impressed by the waitress/owners attitude.

R4qV39Y7xWglwrWTRkkcDw.text: Love this place... If your looking for something new gotta try the bulgogi tacos, fusion lettuce wraps and all the burritos are killer good!! I definitely recommend this place highly!! You won't be disappointed!

yftnnFRuwBs3pFLuhzHycw.text: We called in our order 15 minutes before we arrived. They had a table all ready for us with our food waiting. We ordered the bulgogi cheese steak, kimchee fried rice, and a half order of the bulgogi nachos. The sandwich was insanely delicious. The nachos were loaded with toppings and were excellent. The kimchee fried rice had a fried egg on top and were perfectly seasoned.  The chef and waitress were friendly and very accommodating.  This will definitely be one of my new weekly stops.

8udQYBcVigpRKCGzKUhm6A.text: The Korean fusion thing has been getting a little out of hand. Since Kogi truck, korean-inspired foods have been popping up everywhere. I'm a little bit of a Korean-food purist--why mess with a good thing? But I can't complain (too much) about the grub they serve up at KoMex.  FUSION TACOS: You have the option of beef, chicken, or pork. I sampled one of each in addition to a plain old shrimp taco. I added fried kimchi on one of them for an extra $1.. I won't ever do that again. Kimchi is good with a lot of things; just not on my tacos. The kimchi was a little too sour for my taste. The tacos without that extra Korean element were quite good though! The cabbage was crunchy, and it was balanced with just the perfect amount of onion, cilantro, and darn good pico.  VARIETY: This tiny restaurant has a huge menu. Korean Mexican food, Mexican food, American food, and Chinese. Now if they only made donuts... I want to say they're DTM. But the food here is good. I tried a little of everything; nothing great, nothing awful. The 'KoMex' gimmick isn't anything special. But if you're craving a cheeseburger with your KBBQ taco and taquitos, KoMex is a one stop shop.

EAuJyVKEOr-bVV46E4ZvTA.text: Tofu enchiladas?! I can't even find that stuff in LA!  KoMex is a gem. It's cheap, it's fast, it's unique and most importantly it's TASTY! I love the concept of fusion foods, makes me feel more American. :P It's awesome to see different cultures mix so well together!   I came here before leaving Las Vegas. It's no where near the strip (thank god...I was growing quite weary of obnoxiously drunk and loud Jersey Shore rejects swarming the streets).   We ordered:  Chow Fettuccine - Chow mein but with italian fettucine noodles wok stir fried with red onions, cabbage, korean bbq beef, shrimp and chicken. All for $10!! Can't beat that, especially if you lost all your dough in Vegas.  TOFU ENCHILADAS!!  - Sounds weird, tastes awesome. The plate comes with rice, beans, tomato, shredded lettuce and red sauce. (forgot how much it was tho)   There was also complimentary chunky salsa and guac and chips (with free refills!). And might I say, it was the most delicious FUH-REE guac and salsa I've eva haaaaaaad!   Come here if yous a broke mofo.... or if you just love fusion food!

YPTd1z9LqnJFg98tNOQPSw.text: Customer service was great and super friendly! Understaffed however always felt like I was very important to them as a customer. Food came out very quickly however menu was confusing a bit. They have a sign that says the food is made to order to maintain freshness and that it is not fast food however I received my food in 6 minutes and 27 seconds. This makes me question as to if it is really cooked to order or if the food is prepared beforehand. I had the regular beef bulgogi with rice and it was good however I got some cartilage in my meat. The food was really delicious overall and I will return in the near future. I absolutely recommend coming here!

sXS2CtWJrCzc69FKFzgrSA.text: Unexpected flavors at an unassuming place! I am definitely glad I went out my way to come and try Komex. This 'hole in the wall' offers a unique blend of flavors and textures and delivers foods sure to please (and surprise) your taste buds.   Not only is the food awesome, but the service is amazing.  The lady who took care of me today (the owner I'd assume) greeted me with a smile and, being my first time, was welcoming and recommended some amazing dishes.   I tried the bulgogi, pork and shrimp tacos and they were all very good. In fact, I got a second shrimp taco due to its amazing flavor. I also ordered fried pork wontons which were freshly fried and the pork was juicy and flavorful. Do yourself a favor and come try this place.

pKnA8q8HYT6ZpXA3XyMSFg.text: You have to try this place! Their bulgogi burrito is amazing and would recommend to anyone. You can always order half if you want to try more and not get full too quick. Their service and waiting is okay, considering it does take a while to cook the food and it seems to be busy whenever we come. The only downside I saw was their spam musubi, which is not the best I've tried but the rest of the menu is worth trying.

fBmkaMGwj1j3fEyDflhV4w.text: Decided to try this hidden gem last week and have to say so glad we did.  Place is pretty much in the corner and parking is not too easy as it is limited due to other businesses but again worth the maneuver!  Lots of choices so it was a bit of a hard decision - ended up going with the Korean beef half & half nachos (1/2 fries 1/2 chips) - meat was absolutely to die for!!  Make sure you try the pork belly taco and if you have enough room order a chicken taco as well. Only downside is no alcohol but definitely not a deal breaker.  Will try again soon!!

lXPwXin0nzn9v9tvufN-uQ.text: Great food! You have to try the Fusion Bulgogi Nachos, possibly the best nachos ever! Meat, Mozzarella Cheese, Pico de Gallo, Jalapeno & Spicy Korean Hot Sauce.  Inexpensive (not cheap), 2 people, 4 dishes (took half of 2 dishes home), drinks (iced tea), tip, $36.

OAf76N2eggWrdYesPlxKmg.text: Read about this place for cheap eats os 2012 during my visit to Vegas. Place was not hard to find and so glad I made the trip out. The bulgogi nachos were amazing and the prices are really reasonable. The nachos were crisp and full of flavors. The bulgogi was so tender and juicy. The cheese was stringy and sweet. All the flavors blended together so well. Had the chicken taco which was amazing and tasted so authentic. Wish I could have one of these in my neighborhood because this would be weekly visit and definitely a drunkie's dream come True!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Going on some bomb chicken taco n bulgogi nachos

fleueZ4ugZrIELU4iWQqQA.text: Being Korean and loving Mexican food... I of course had to try this place.  Also the great Yelp reviews helped.  I wasn't disappointed.  Wow!  This is one of those places where you wish they had a location near your home.  Unfortunately, it's only in Vegas.      So if you're in Vegas you have to make a trip to try this mom and pop shop with the yummiest pul go gi burrito.  Awesome..  yummmy spicy  korean pork nachos... that's right you heard me... spicy korean nachos.  I know.. I originally though.. uh-huh cheese and korean pork... doesn't go together..  WRONG!  it's ono licious!  lick your fingers. yummy!  It's not the easiest place to find if you're going by strict GPS directions.. once you get really close 500 feet.. you have to use your eyes to find the place.  The only mild negative is that, BECAUSE it's made to order... you have to wait.  We waited 20 minutes, but it was worth it.    The food is hot and fresh, like mom or grandma would have made in their kitchen.  If you like spicy and sweet... with some teriyaki style flavors... this is the place for you!

iLMEun3rgUYFWdRmrzyf7g.text: this place was really good! i had read a few reviews just to see what to order and my group of 6 had 3 orders of everything they wanted and nothing disappointing!! it was all flavorful. the place looks dingy but dont let that detour you. the owners are VERY courteous and help with any thing they can.  A MUST GO. off the vegas strip great food!

fYsGDy299lnla_kT3U9zfQ.text: Despite the shabby appearence, this place has some really fantasic food. I recomend trying the fusion tacos, although I have yet to get something bad from them. And be sure to get an order of wontons for only $1!  It can sometimes be busy 12-1, for the lunch crowd. But off hours get you the best service, and if you wait for the busy hours, it WILL be worth it.  I ordered beef fusion tacos on flour this visit, and they are great.

suDDISiZRpTWwHGTNbmRdg.text: One of my favorite joints in Vegas. This is our go to place when we're super hungry, because we can get amazing food for the price. Not once have we ever been disappointed. My favorite is the bulgogi fried rice and calamari tacos. They have a house salsa that is spot on with the Korean/Mexican fusion. I dump it on everything!

3STrG8gqC2hE_o1Wqk5X9g.text: Ate there the other day, and best description of their food.. "wow".  Instant seating, ambiance & location would only rate 1 star at most.. but the food makes all the diff and that IS the point of a restaurant.    I had 2 Fusion Tacos, one with chicken and the other with pork.  I had no idea so much filler could fit on those little tacos, but they were both excellent - I especially loved the chicken one.  Hubby got the Bulgogi burrito and I could have sworn I saw little hearts fluttering around him when he bit into that monster.  I'll admit, I was surprised by the amount of damage he did to that, since I think there are countries with less land mass than that thing had.  And yes, I had a taste of it.. definitely a winner.  Oh, and I had made the mistake of ordering the Spam Musubi - not that there was anything wrong with it, just no room left to fit it into my tummy after the tacos.  Once I started on them, the musubi just kinda got forgotten about.. I took it home, though, and had it the next day - still tasty despite being a day old, so I'm betting it would have been fantastic when it was fresh.  We will definitely be back, and soon =D

vhvv0pOfgcXemPNt0yDw4g.text: Great tacos!  I mean GREAT tacos!  Been here many times through the years and have never been disappointed.  Whenever I am in the Las Vegas area I always make an effort to come.  They do a great job with the Bol-go-gi tacos and rice.  Their burritos are a good size and you always get free chips and salsa/guacamole.  Service is always quick and attentive!

Dk9GcJL67us4P75Os7faTw.text: I just can't tell you how much delicious Korean/Mexican fusion food they have. I love the various fusion tacos. You just can't have one. I've been going here for quite some time now and it has never disappoint me in any way. It does get busy sometimes and you might have to wait for a few minutes because they have about 20-30 seats for people. It's small in there but the food is worth the wait. Customer service is very good. I love trying new fusion food. This is must try place for locals and tourist.

1SVO9vbR4aKUHxVLsLz_9w.text: Went there for a friends birthday. I ordered the bulgogi nachos/fries combo and fusion wings, my wife ordered the bulgogi burrito. The nachos was by far..... the best! Everything else was okay. The fusion wings seemed to have been tossed in a deep fryer (plain, no seasoning) and simply rolled in their special sauce... nothing special. The bulgogi burrito, just a normal burrito with korean beef.... again, nothing special. And the bulgogi fries.... just get the nachos instead. All in all, if you're expecting to be punched in the mouth with a whole bunch of "fusion" flavor, this is not the place for you. But if you simply want a decent affordable meal, komex is the place. Would I eat here again? Only for another birthday dinner or IF I were in the area.

itqjBAI20lFjXqr5nEbS4Q.text: I LOVE their food! I've had quite a few things on the menu, and I've never been disappointed. My favorite dishes is the bulgogi tacos and bulgogi nachos. But explore, because they make good food!!  This is a mom & pop type of place so don't expect the fine dining experience. But honestly, some of the best foods I've had have been at these type of places.

cV9p3aPjLsB4CoWuK53o-Q.text: I was doubtful on coming here. Korean and Mexican fusion just sounds... no. Don't judge a book by it's cover though, this has to be one of my top favorite family-owned businesses in Las Vegas!   We came on a weekday night, an hour about closing. Apparently this night they were short staffed, and the place was busy, so service took longer than expected (but of course, was understood). I do not eat meat, but thank goodness they had vegetarian options on their menu. I had the fusion tacos sans the meat, but added kimchi. Even without the meat, the lettuce wrap tacos with kimchi were delicious!  My friends ordered the fusion tacos with beef and pork, and everyone at our table was highly please by the taste for such a cheap, cheap price (I believe it was $1.95 for the tacos, where can you get a better deal than that other than at a Taco Bell or Del Taco?!)  While the service was slammed that night, we were able to talk to one of the owners who, while very busy, still showed awesome service to us, even when we had many questions to ask amongst how busy it was. Very nice owner who is willing to explain everything down to the last ingredient. Will definitely return here again, this is my new favorite fusion restaurant! (That ISN'T fast-food!)

tBh_lQMdLqO0F1YcMNLGaA.text: My husband and I decided to try this place based on a friend's recommendation. It was very good! We tried their Bulgogi burrito and it makes you think why has no one ever done it before. The staff was helpful and friendly and through the yelp deal, we got a free order of fried wontons. Their chips and salsa was also tasty.  The only downside is that I wished they had a bigger location do seating wouldn't be a problem. With how popular this joint is becomingg, customers are having some trouble fighting for tables.

uoO2c4NDvv5gtjygQyViqg.text: Honestly this restaurant deserves much more recognition. The food and service they provide is beyond enjoyable and amazing. You don't ever feel unattended or uncomfortable. The host makes your food in a jiffy and helps you out if you are indecisive. Coming from California this place is the star of everywhere I've eaten in Las Vegas. If you're considering this place just go, enjoy the food, and leave with a happy tummy.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LG6c26rysSZLhyTSWz191w.text: Really good actually and pretty healthy as you can get lettuce wraps instead of corn or flour tortillas.  Surprisingly inexpensive especially considering how great the food tasted. The service was excellent too!

6kiYjnXljpG5qeVlrstCvw.text: I checked out this place because a friend of mine highly recommended it.  It's a Mexican restaurant served with Korean style meats, basically a fusion joint hence the name.  The food was ok, we sampled the bulgogi chimichanga, chicken quesadilla, and pork/spam kimchi fried rice.  Being from Hawaii, I've had my share of pretty awesome Korean food, Mexican not so much.  The fusion of styles actually works quite well, but I won't be going back.  Not because of the food...  ...because of the service...so I walked in for the first time and was given a menu and told they would take my order when I was ready.  I politely chimed in that I was trying the place for the first on a very high recommendation of a friend and asked what they would suggest for my first time.  Apparently they didn't care much that they were recommended as I was abruptly told it was a Mexican restaurant served with Korean meats...yeah, I kind of knew that...then recommended I have what my friend had..Idk what they had, and was pretty turned off at that point...so yeah, long story short, wasn't worth the money paid, but it wasn't horrible...and if you're going to check it out for yourself, definitely look at the menu ahead of time and have an idea of what you want to order before going in.

ePLsHaOfRpJ1gz_eNfKGKw.text: Haven't been here in awhile but menu is really standout. It's got plenty of delicious choices and this location is very relaxing inside from what I remember. Love the concept behind the place and the execution is really exceptional.

62XLQQGG0rw2GMoncXZMpA.text: This is our all time favorite family restaurant! Delicious food!  Today  we had a Bulgogi Tostada, Bulgogi Grilled Cheese, Bulgogi Nachos, Bulgogi slider with French fries, Quesadilla and Spam Masubi!! Needless to We had to get to go boxes!  YUMMY!

Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States

z0FXmN6Sa3dzJaqC17ZC6A.text: It's one of my go-to restaurants..If you can find parking, it's a GREAT place to eat !! A Fusion between mexican-korean dishes. YUM !

-DiArcLzbMrGJ2UWEpDthA.text: Oh my gosh, i cant tell you how excited I was to find out that there are at least a few Korean fusion places here in Vegas. There are literally none in WA where I just moved from and they are totally missing out.   I've been to a ton of Korean fusion places in CA where Korean pizza is my favorite thing of all time. I have yet to find that here, but Korean + Mexican sounded amazing too so I made sure to come here as soon as I moved here.   I ordered the Bulgogi flautas which were heaven. The meat was full of flavor, not fatty, and juicy. The outside of the flautas was light, but crispy which made for an overall amazing texture. There are some foods that I just can't stand just do to texture so I'm glad these passed both the flavor and texture test. I love that they sell Mexican coke here too.   The place was clean, the staff were very friendly, the cost was decent, and the wait really wasn't bad considering it's all made fresh when you order.

msQELCpm216SJbG--EzxwQ.text: I was starving after being at car dealerships all day, and this is across from Friendly Ford on Decatur and the 95. Thanks Yelpers for the great reviews! I read the first few and was sold!  I took the advice of a couple people and got the bulgogi grilled cheese. It is more of a ton of (delicious) meat sandwich but still amazing! I dipped it in their "Mexican Soy Sauce" it whatever he called it. Haha  So good! Can't wait to try it again!

QeLK0tXVeHdDkGRcnjlHxA.text: So pretty average which is surprising based on the reviews of this place. We ordered the Kim Chee fried rice. The pork chimichanga. And the beef bulgogi and spicy pork plate. The fried rice was heavy on the Kim chee flavor which is fine but it was a little too wet with Kim chee juice. The chimichanga wasn't too bad. Can't go wrong with a fried burrito essentially. The beef bulgogi was disappointing; dry and tough. The flavor also wasn't what I expected it was more sweet than anything. The spicy pork was pretty good but not very spicy and also a bit dry. Service though was awesome! The guy was maybe the owner or manager; he was very nice. Overall I may try this place again maybe it was an off day.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oPysfEdF81t9RUlpAuGVPQ.text: I got the Fusion Shrimp Enchilada and the combination fried rice!! The Fusion Shrimp Enchilada was off the chain!! It's going to be hard to try a different dish my next time there!! The combination fried rice was good also.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND the Fusion Shrimp Enchilada!!  BOMB!!

JZdoEhrHeyleZPdD7OHVfw.text: Hidden gem!! I'm slightly embarassed to say that I've come here 5 days in a row at some point, but I also don't regret any of it! Everything on the menu that I've tried has been amazing and the food is always fresh and tasty. I definitely recommend the Spicy Pork Bulgogi on any dish, especially the rice bowl and the bulgogi plate.  Never disappointed!! So happy I found this place

negmYzoX2tjr-91bf9b1jw.text: *** Credit card/debit card payment less than $10 will be charged extra $0.50 ***  You could say KoMex Fusion is similar to Kogi BBQ Truck in Los Angeles (founded by Roy Choi), but KoMex Fusion offers more than just Korean fusion tacos & burritos. You'll also find kimchi fried rice, musubi, wonton soup, enchitada, traditional Mexican burritos & tacos, etc.  The restaurant is hidden in a strip mall (approximately 15~20 minutes drive from the Strip) & there's another KoMex Fusion location (intersection of Buffalo & Flamingo), but I intentionally drove here because I wanted to visit the original location.  ***  Complimentary chips: Good guacamole with some diced tomato. Salsa tasted slightly spicy and chips were freshly made (crunchy with a soft texture).   Calamari Taco (flour tortilla with lettuce, pico de gallo, fusion tartar sauces - $3): Pretty good calamari and solid tortilla chip. Salsa was decent, but it could be better. You probably need tot add your own hot sauce to improve the overall flavors.  Beef Kimchi Fried Rice (fried egg on top, 1/2 serving for $8): Good seasoning and I like this dish.  Pork Belly Musubi (marinated rice wrapped in nori aka dried seaweed, 2 pieces for $6): Average pork belly + rice + seaweed = wait did I really pay $6 for this order?  ***  Good cheap eat in Vegas (in fact my dinner on that night was my leftover from KoMex) and my recommendation is to get kimchi fried rice (good portion) & avoid any musubi (not worth what you are paying for).  P.S. - You'll get a fortune cookie at the end of your meal!  P.P.S. - 5% off the bill if you pay with cash!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Kimchi Fried Rice (1/2 serving for $8) + Calamari Taco (flour tortilla with lettuce, pico de gallo, fusion tartar sauces - $3)
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Belly Musubi (marinated rice wrapped in nori aka dried seaweed, 2 pieces for $6)
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary chips

5EtnZT6vRrE-mz5b2uQ8kQ.text: Phenomenal fish tacos.. excellent soups and stir fry. Get in here and eat. Great value and great staff.. You'll be glad you did. Food is prepared fresh and is wonderful.

m9aYkcpE27DT8IH7W-7mPg.text: Komex, just the name alone caught my attention! Being half Mexican and Japanese, who am I to judge for loving fusions! Especially Korean and Mexican cuisine. The tostada with the rice patty and the bulgolgi is amazing!!!! The crunch of the Komex slaw and the rice patty with the flavor of the meat is indeed a plate I finished all too quickly! Next my order of tatertots was just the cherry on top! The bacon, in different cuts mind you kept teasing my taste buds. The cripsy tots kept bursting with flavor from the bulgolgi!!! This place is sorta hidden, but I'm so happy I found this place!!! KOMEX found a new customer for their delicious fusion food!!!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Komex version tostada and tater tots are insanely delcious!!!

ytCPbyPFhaKlnGJbjqxBHQ.text: This is one of my favorites they have the best lettuce tacos. Great customer service and close to home.

hrMtkjcLgKU7_OSXERSu1A.text: Before I became vegetarian I used to love to eat here. It's an awesome place with delicious food. I still take my meat-eating guests, and they rave!

cIGDccaNeVpSJgFayFscZQ.text: I've had Korean-Mexican countless times, but KoMex takes it to the next level with the variety of fusion they offer - plus, if you're not feeling Korean-Mexican, you can just get Korean OR Mexican by itself.  I opted for kimchi fried rice with beef (a non-fusion item), and it's a rather generous portion. Not as much beef as I would have liked, but kimchi fried rice usually doesn't have a whole bunch of beef to begin with.  If I came by KoMex again, I would stick with their fusion options as that what makes them stick out (their fusion chimichanga sounds delicious!). The restaurant isn't glam by any means, but it's also quite possibly the most affordable fusion place I've been to, so come with an appetite to chow down.

Wlui1mO3GHYNONSN1Bzzyw.text: Been going here for years. I love practically anything on the menu but the fusion nachos or fusion chimichanga have a special place in my stomach and heart. The place is straight up delish.

IO95LGMhyNEWM_PSLT9J5w.text: I've been coming to this place for years and it never disappoints!!! I normally get the bulgogi tostada which is on a crispy rice patty and a shrimp lettuce wrap.

xNW7RGojzttJNN6DhB7LwQ.text: I tried the chicken fusion quesadilla and it was filling.  The chicken was grilled and the dish itself wasn't bad.  Portion size was decent.  The plate also comes with some lettuce/tomato and sour cream.    Was there fusion?  Yeah.  The chicken was grilled chicken, but I did not taste any Asian in it.  I'd love to try this place next time and try something more with Asian fusion to it.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fusion quesadilla. $8
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Dusion quesadilla. $8

zBZlz0irfXcjVF-VV05YRA.text: Great food! Nice cozy spot, across from ford, the first time I came here I was getting my car worked in and I was starving, I ordered so much food and was not disappointed. Love this place, going to keep coming back.

ETzIsNZ7gmriW7ptd3pMDQ.text: I like KoMex, my husband loves it. This last time I got the wonton soup - so flavorful and an egg was stirred in it - and the chicken wings that I ended up taking home. Husband had the enchiladas and the iced tee; he couldn't stop talking about how good everything was. He especially enjoyed the tea - which was funny, because if he had been offered Mango-passion fruit tea instead of just iced tea he would have said "no way" cuz it sounds to fruity, but he loved it! LOL

0IPTg7fkeUDrkqaYsPikJA.text: The food was really good! I have been looking for a spot like this! A place that cooks the food when we order it and makes it like how they would eat it at home. The tots plate was delicious with the bulgogi rice plate. It a simple restaurant and chill atmosphere. If you want quality food it's here at a very good price!

tNlqwWPrDd3Hxp_1ZG1eig.text: 2 four star reviews in a row? I need to slow down, but KoMex was just that good.  Rewind to last Sunday (11/27/11) - was on my way home from Mt. Charleston and had previously looked up what was on my "to try list" that was near by. I'm not making a special trip out from Henderson for tacos, so this was the perfect reason to stop in.  I already knew what I wanted - one of each of the fusion tacos - beef, chicken and pork. I ordered them with kimchi and extra hot hot sauce. (I'm guessing it was Sriracha.) I was also given a free order of wontons, filled with meat!!! for checking in on Yelp! A very big meal for less than $5...that tastes awesome! Finally!  If I lived close, you couldn't keep me away from this joint. Unfortunately, this place is way out of the way for me, but I will return!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Killer tacos - beef, chicken and pork. 11/27/11
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free meat wontons with Yelp Check-In! 11/27/11

3G0or6aEhqp_ct0WjiLtJQ.text: Found this local favorite through Yelp. Super gigantic portions - familiar Korean favorites (bulgogi) as well as Mexican staples (burritos, tacos, chimichangas) with Korean/Asian ingredients. In particular, the burritos are as big as nuclear bombs. Bonus points for free chips, guacamole, and salsa at your table.  While the portions are large and super tasty, I left feeling super thirsty after trying a bulgogi combo plate with beef and spicy pork. Without further experience here with other menu items, I'd have to attribute this to heavy use of salt, oil, and/or MSG.  The space itself is tiny, with tables for about 25 people max, and service is somewhat rushed because of the tremendous volume they get. Still, a very dependable local option when it comes to portion size, price, and value. Great for feeding small families.
