First off, we showed up basically at closing and the owners let us dine in and were incredibly nice. This was exactly what I was looking for, a diamond in the rough. I love little joints that are tucked away that just blow your mind. This needs to be on Diners drive ins and dives. Guy would love this place!   We ordered a bulgogi burrito and quesadilla and pork tacos. The burrito was honestly hands down the best burrito I have ever had...ever. Everything about it was great the meat was well marinated and full of flavor. Tacos were intoxicating and same goes for the quesadilla. We could taste the passion within every bite of every dish. Its easy to see that they have a lot of pride within their food.   They are located in a little shopping center and could be easily missed if youre from out of town and dont have GPS. Inside is plain but decorated with newspaper and magazine articles notating KoMex's awesomeness. Honestly who cares about what this place looks like its all about the food here.   I recommend KoMex to anyone and everyone. Its only about 15 mins from the strip and worth it. I would drive any distance to get to Komex.   I want to thank the owner who I never got the name of for letting us eat right at closing. It was very nice meeting you and we enjoyed the conversation after our meal. PLEASE OPEN A KOMEX IN CALIFORNIA! If not we will be back soon! Any time im in vegas i am going to KoMex, new tradition.

DR1E4mkCbYTHmUCRuPhSOg.text: Starts off you off with free unlimited chips that is served with guacamole and salsa.. Delicious! It is definitely worth the price of the tacos. I ordered the bulgogi, daegigogi, and the asada tacos. Definitely worth the price. Each taco was $1.29 and it was very delicious. After your meal they give you a half sliced orange as a dessert.   Their service was perfect, the food was excellent, and the price was incredibly low for what you get. I will definitely come back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zCB5qKSBA1QeJYgmrr6rSA.text: AMAZING.....This is the word I have to use for this place. I love Korean BBQ and I was amazed to see that they came up with this fusion concept to have taco's with Korean BBQ.   And the price was cherry on the top...

EXW4Z-dcwFxqneFFk6a1MA.text: Awesome food at even more amazing prices. I was in vegas and had searched some of the good places to try and Komex came up. I took my parents and we drove over.  We each ordered a bulgogi burrito. we also tried a pork taco and a bulgogi taco. I have had korean fusion before, but this was even better. The food does take a while to come out, but its worth the wait.  Oh and while you are waiting for your food-they serve homemade chips  with guac and salsa- delish!   totally worth the drive from the strip. total meal for 4 of us was under $30 wtih tax-- yay!  oh and they serve bottled water instead of tap as part of your meal- so nice! Love you Komex

tleO75mf8PbeiLuagZ7VAw.text: I went in the other day just to take a peek at the menu while I was waiting for my insurance agent. They offer a full menu at competitive prices. They made upgrades to the dining area since that last time I've been there. ( got rid of those seat pads) The house fried rice and boglie ( spell check) nachos are a must. I will be back very soon.

B1QVbEh9tGLb6KYeae47Jw.text: I have been hearing how great this place is.  I'm here to tell you that it lives up to the hype.  The pork bolgogi was really great - super tender meat with just the right amount of seasoning.  My friend ordered the Korean tacos - one chicken and one pork and a fusion burrito. He gave the thumbs up to all of it.  The service was great - very fast for the place being filled to capacity and a line of people waiting outside to get in.  The portions are big and the prices are low. I think the tacos were about $1.29 each. I can't wait to go back and try more items on the menu.    Go support this oustanding small business.  You'll be glad that you did!

XeRXSdL5lW9jAf3F-R8QQQ.text: One more five star rating for this great hidden treasure. The fusion portion of the menu was incredible. Owners were very friendly. Prices were reasonable.   Only down side is the crowd and the parking. With food this good, I understand why those are a problem.

Gr79EOpTJGRoJiIKyVF0hg.text: This is interesting. Any way you can pack bulgogi into a mexican container is good by me. Cheap, fast and heaping portions along with the fusion aspect makes this a worthwhile. A little one-trick-pony-ish in the long run, but good stuff. Small locale, fast friendly service.

4FWmg3Ipec10GuUJAAAouA.text: Great food. Thank god I like it spicy. I took some home to some kids not considering the spice level and they said it was too hot. So be mindful of that. I ordered the fusion nachos, burrito, 3 tacos each with a different meat, a lettuce taco with kimchi and vegetarian noodle dish. Because I was traveling, sharing and heard it was cheap. My favorite was the burrito, then the nachos. It was all good but I didn't care for the noodles (just me). The only thing that bugged me was the waitress kept wiping sweat off her brow and I was hoping she was catching all of it. I hope someone recommends her to wear a sweat band like the tennis players do.

rF4ViXNAER22T3XhxYoRuA.text: Tried to go here twice. Both times closed. Won't waste my time anymore. They don't wanna keep a regular schedule they don't need my $

CrPKkq_uUgzI9-TVhlhSsA.text: Been going here forever, always order the same thing--veggie burrito with quac,, onions, beans rice, blah, blah. I come here so often (it's in my hood and it's my go-to cuz it's super consistent) that the owner said "just call it the Rose burrito" so I do, saves me time telling him what I want in it. Weather is good or bad, life is up or down, the owner answers and my burrito is there waiting for me 15 minutes later.

ecricn2mkYzBWupUxjnr-w.text: Saw a bunch of good reviews for this place & decided to try something different. This is kind of a "hole in the wall" spot on Decatur amid boring & bland restaurants & shops (except Pepe's!) so I wasn't expecting too much. But their menu & customer service were pleasantly surprising!   Boyfriend got the fusion torta with pork belly (which was extra) & I got the fusion chimichanga with bulgogi. Yum! My chimichanga was topped with their "Komex Slaw" which had tons of flavor & made the dish IMO. (Boyfriend got a side of it & put it right in his sandwich. He says if you get the torta, this is a must)   All in all, not a bad way to spend $20 & we'll definitely be coming back to try their other dishes!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fusion chimichanga
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fusion Torta with pork belly

UZ1wJPNyeh8B_JtjnUr1aw.text: Let me just start by saying I ordered way too much, but I enjoyed every single last bite. The chips - homemade, refried every other hour but they're not oily at all, I could eat them forever The tacos - they're fat, you definitely get your money's worth. The meat is tender, packed with flavor, these are great tacos. Wonton soup - It tastes somewhat different from your usual takeout wonton soup, has a Korean twist to the flavor of the broth. It's refreshing, wontons taste great. Kimchi Fried Rice - It's not fried, most likely done in a rice container. Still, it tastes amazing.  Bulgogi Sliders - The marinade for the beef is sweet, but not too sweet that you can't finish the dish. It's sweeter than what I'm used to, but these are definitely good to try out.  Server, who is also the owner, handles multiple tables flawlessly, doesn't mess up a single order. She keeps water filled, always makes sure we're enjoying everything she's served. Pleasant.

JCV2Vf-viTKX0GOXeTMHIw.text: Food was definitely the kind you call comfort food. I got the bulgogi tater skillet and my hubby got the bulgogi torta plus an order of wings. We ate it all!! Yep! That yummy! The skillet was on the smaller side but the tater tots were filling so I can't complain.  The service was nice and friendly.   Will definitely be back.

MbxxIQuWERhSoP_dKp92BQ.text: Really good food! I wasn't sure what I was in for, but I do like Korean and Mexican cuisine so I figured it was worth a shot. I'm so glad we tried it. One guy had bulgogi and fried rice, it was a generous portion good for people with big appetites. I had a shrimp taco, bulgogi taco, and a pork belly taco. They were very flavorful. The house sauces, a spicy sauce and a sweet sauce, really took the dishes over the top.   There were some kids with us who happily chowed down on spam musubi and gave it a thumbs up.

hDtKuws-EZAC9jZhhZ5NZg.text: My friend and I were at Meadows Mall and wanted lunch but not familiar with the area. So I used my trusty Yelp app to find nearby restaurants and up popped this "fusion" place. I couldn't resist checking it out seeing how all of the Yelp reviews were 5-stars and people raved, so I had to try it.   This place is one of those drive-by-and-if-you-blink-you-miss-it joints. Located in a crowded strip mall - a little hole in the wall place and definitely a well kept Vegas secret. This place is AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I'm serious. They give you nice crispy complimentary chips, salsa and guacamole which was really yummy. I ordered a fusion burrito with tofu yum yum yum YUM!!! it has tasty fresh ingredients, Mexican Rice, Green & Brown Onions, Pico de Gallo, Cilantro, Lettuce, Asian Soy/Sesame base Sauce. Be warned though that it is enormous so either be really hungry or take the rest home like I did. It was delish the next day.   My friend had the fusion bulgogi (beef) tacos and she said they were amazing as well. I can't wait to come back and try the nachos!!!!!   They have that awesome bottled Mexican Pepsi and Mexican Coke, how cool is that? They also carry pineapple jarritos beverage. I drank unsweetened mango passionfruit iced tea and that was really different, very tasty.   Fast and friendly service. And this place is CHEAP!! My entire lunch bill was $8. We will be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fusion burrito w tofu nom nom nom
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fusion bulgogi tacos

HOj4yjvnf3OYnbbJh2iSVA.text: Absolutely love this place. The location makes it a little tough to find, but that's what makes this place a hidden gem. The parking can be a little difficult so I would advise to go after lunch madness.   The owner is extremely nice and the servers are more than willing to give you recommendations. The price isn't bad either. The flautas are what I always get but you can't go wrong with any of the fusion foods. C'mon were talking about Korean food with Mexican goodness, you can't help but feel giddy just hearing it.

OznoV8JJ-W8sYIj_sp5KEg.text: Tried this place while on a business trip to Vegas. Very delicious. Mixture of Korean food and Mexican. Tried the fusion burrito with bulgogi beef.

TRbv5VxyNMKxpbktS4RzUg.text: We tried KoMex, a Korean Mexican fusion joint in Vegas, because being from Hawaii, that's not weird at all. Korean is good. Mexican is good. Fusion is good. Sounded like a win. Besides Bulgogi is gold if done right.   The bulgogi fries: delicious and what you'd expect from marrying decent bulgogi with fries and bold fusion sauces. Can't say I've had anything like it. Bars should take notice because I'd describe this dish as the drunk person's best friend at 2 in the morning. But maybe the fries are too soggy to be sober. So it's like yummy bulgogi fusion-ness on mashed fries.  The bulgogi burrito was pretty great because we weren't expecting a Mexican burrito. We expected a KoMex bulgogi burrito. Whatever that is. It was so tasty I'd order it again. On the same note our friends raved about the bulgogi chimichanga and chicken bulgogi.   Not bad at all for being next to a gas station and such things. Oh, they serve free chips and salsa if anything. Yippee.

fOie6-lbtNWGWeyGdVXehg.text: The first time I went to KoMex, I thought maybe I made a mistake. The area and the exterior looked kind of iffy but when I got inside, it was packed!  So, I decided to stay and a friendly hostess showed me to my table.  I had the bulgogi, daeji and dak gogi tacos plus a side of bulgogi fries.  They were all flavorful.  The bulgogi fries can feed 2 very hungry peeps.  Imagine a pile of crispy golden fries topped with melted cheese, jalapenos, hot sauce and bulgogi...sweet, savory, spicy all in one. YUUUUMMMM!!!    My next visits, I tried the calamari tacos (tender calamari, lightly breaded) and my KoMex favorite: bulgogi chimichanga.  It's incredibly cheesy, crispy, meaty and tasty.  It may be a bit oily but it's alright.  Just thinking about it is making me hungry.  Great service, amazing food at very affordable prices.  You get chips, salsa and guac for free.  At the end of your meal, you get fortune cookies and sliced oranges speared with little plastic swords.  It's Korean, it's Mexican...it's KoMex!!!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kimchee fried rice
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi fries and bulgogi chimichanga (my faves!)
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi tacos

zChg_AQw0Mvd53YBU7l94Q.text: Dear Komex,  I expected to love you. I wanted to love you. I just knew I would love you. However, something somewhere just fell short for me. I LIKED you but definitely did not LOVE you.  I had booked marked you as a place to visit many moons ago. So in the car on the drive over to your place of business I was like a little school girl on the first day of school - excited, nervous and anxious.   We pulled up and saw the long line outside the door and the place inside packed. (This just reaffirmed to me, how much I was going to love you.) Despite the long lines and how packed it was,  we were seated within 15 minutes.   The menu looked good. I didn't know what to get. I settled on a fusion calamari taco and a half order of bulgolgi nachos with a side of kimchi, bulgolgi fried rice and spam musubi.  We munched on warm tortilla chips with two small containers of salsa and guacamole (courtesy of your restaurant) while we waited for our food. My nachos came out first and I thought they were going to be topped with the kimchi but they were not. Instead, I received my kimchi about 5 minutes later.  Let's talk about your bulgolgi nachos for a bit. They LOOK good. However, upon dissection all it is a HUGE plate of chips with skimpy toppings. The toppings there do equate to good flavor and a yummy taste but the ratio of chips to meat and cheese is lacking. I was slightly pissed off because of the lack of bulgolgi on my nachos. It was like it was sprinkled on quickly as an after thought. If I am paying $6.00 for a half order of nachos, I expect just a little bit more. Why not layer your nachos so that you get yummy toppings throughout? Because after you eat the top layer, you are left with plain ole tortilla chips. How fun or good is that? Think about it, okay?  Kim chi. Is it jarred? And why is it chopped up so little? And kimchi should have some spicy heatness to it. This kimchi lacked in serious flavor. I swear it is jarred and I am thinking you might be able to get more flavor profile if you make your own. Think about it, okay?  The fusion calamari taco. It wasn't bad. I don't have much to pick on about it. I ate it all. However, I don't know what I expected in my head but fusion just made me think it would be so different. It was just two long pieces of deep fried calamari on a flour tortilla with some lettuce and toppings and fusion tartar sauce. I LIKED it, but didn't LOVE it.  Bulgogi  Fried Rice. You win in portion amount. Hands down. It is big just like the nachos. But when the first word is Bulgolgi, I expect more bulgolgi. I should have caught on when the waitress kept correcting me and calling it beef. I just thought she was being rude and didn't like the way I was saying it. The flavor profile in this fried rice is decent. I am a self proclaimed fried rice snob and I can honestly say I didn't have to add anything to it to make it taste better. I just needed more meat. I would gladly receive a smaller portion to get a bulgolgi fried rice. Think about it okay?  Spam Musubi. Oh yeah. This was your saving grace, I bit into this sucker and it was like the angels started singing to me. But spam and nori, what is not to love?  So Komex, what am I left with? Would I return? Yes. I did LIKE you. Will I rush back? No. You are bit too far and just need to make some improvements.   Sincerely,  Debra W.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgolgi Nachos with not so much bulgolgi.
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgolgi fried rice. Satisfying but could use more meat.
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spam Musubi. Definitely the highlight of my meal. Hands down delicious!

axoaIrUW98IRodQUiipasA.text: Maybe I'm spoiled because i started eating Majority of my Korean favorites in Hawaii . Hawaii has awesome Korean food .With that being said i was not impressed . I have wanted to try for a long time . I'm glad i got it over with but i will probably not be returning everything was either OK or lacking flavor .   We arrived at around 530 and already had plans to go to the gym . So we took it to go . Since we wanted to try the meats we decided on a Bulgogi Burrito and a combo plate with chicken and Spicy pork . This way we get to try all three meats in one visit. I  have a weakness for Korean & Mexican food so this place was a no brainer for me .   The gentlemen who took our order was prompt to greet us and take our order . During our order I stated i wanted to have the lettuce and pico on the side since we were taking it home and eating it later . I thought the Bulgogi Burrito came with kimchee. More Korean flavor is awesome right ? Nope . In photos it shows it on the side of the burrito but i didn't get any . Thats fine . I can do without the kimchee . What i cant do without is flavorless meat . That's what we got .   Bulgogi Burrito - The wimpy burrito had rice and bulgogi or whats supposed to be bulgogi. People claiming there burritos were humongous . Not mine i could have got a bigger burrito at Roberto's . Maybe it was small because it didn't have lettuce or pico in it . Honestly who wants lettuce in a burrito if food is served warm the lettuce would become soggy . Not a good idea IMO . The meat was lacking flavor and the rice well mexcian rice is simple so nothing stand outish or special about this at all. I even put the sweet/spicy red sauce on the burrito and frankly that's the only thing that saved it . Not to mention my first bite was gristle . I hate gristle . Uhhhh ! Annoying !   Combo Plate - Chicken ans Spicy Pork Combo Plate , Sub white Rice for Spanish rice .   Chicken well it was just chicken not to much flavor just tasted like cut up sauteed chicken . Could use some salt thats how bland it was .   Spicy Pork  - Not even close ? Bland , boring , and weak .   Sauces - Theres a red one that has a weird vinegary taste . Not a fan   Sweet/Spicy Sauce - I actually liked the sweet/spicy sauce that has a sesame flavor , Actually i loved it . I would eat it on any food that i put hot sauce on .   Green Sauce - Standard green Sauce its aiiightt   Pico De Gallo - Needs more cilantro IMO it was ok . Pico doesnt need that much attention not even this was good .   Korean Slaw - Cabbage and cilantro slaw basically . Also boring . Tasteless and boring . I paid a dollar for this crap .   Just get this meal over with is all i can think about . Maybe the marinades need tweaking or marinade for longer . I don't know but they didn't win me over Komex fusion needs to fuse some flavor because Flavortown kicked them out upon arrival .

L0KdQtvq0uHJ_LsIH9jtWg.text: The teriyaki and white rice plate was good but I would not recommend the rice cake tostada the rice was very hard. I did feel extremely rushed by the waiter.   I understand he was there by himself but when I go somewhere I want to sit down and relax to eat I don't want to feel like I cannot take my time ordering.  He was also short of patients explaining the menu.

Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet potato fries
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Teriyaki Chicken and beef with white rice

KebMnT6_y4DxdI_i9UkDAQ.text: NEWS FLASH! THE HYPE IS REAL! I REPEAT, THE HYPE IS REAL! %$#@!@#$% Sorry, that was me banging my head repeatedly on my laptop keyboard because I am so mad at myself for not going to this place a lot sooner! I couldnt wait to get home to do this review and I hope my keyboard is gonna work long enough for me to finish this! I ordered the Bulgogi Beef Burrito and my son ordered the Beef Bulgogi/Spicy Pork combo so we can share. OMG I couldnt make up my mind what to eat so me and my son split both meals. The Burrito has the best of both Korean and Mexican worlds! Now I know why they named themselves that. This tasty choice has Meat with Mexican Rice, Green & Brown Onions, Pico de Gallo, Cilantro, Lettuce, Asian (Soy/Sesame base Sauce). Service is, let me put it this way, a little slow BUT before you jump to conclusions, you have to understand that they make everything from scratch and if a big party before you put their order in, then that is what is gonna go through first. That's understandable because if you ordered before somebody else, whether big or small, you should get it first right? With that said, I was a little irritated at first, but when my food came out and went straight to my mouth I was mad at myself for being irritated because the food is well worth the wait! I recommend that you don't be in a rush to go anywhere else if you plan on eating here and if you can order to go, that's even better because by the time you get there, it should be done. With the popularity of this place blowing up, I see one of two things that might happen: Either they open up another place or move to a much BIGGER location or both. The demand is definitely gonna out do the supply sooner or later because on really busy nights you are definitely gonna have to wait a while to get a table. Some random info: They are closed Mondays so make sure your cravings don't fall on that day! They have free wifi but I couldnt get my phone to work with it so maybe next time I will ask them. Parking can be a nightmare because they share the same small lot with other tenants. They take all major credit cards but be advised that anything under 10 bucks, you will be charged a service fee so as much as you can, pay with cash for all orders under 10 bucks. Its not Komex's fault. Its just that anytime you have a terminal for accepting cards, the company that processes it charges the business owner for every transaction. So you see its not a ploy for Komex to make more money. It's more like a convenience fee for not carrying cash. They don't have a take home menu for the info you need but you can look it up through their website: komexexpress.com So with 350+ reviews averaging 4 1/2 stars, what more reasons do you need NOT to go here?

Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Bulgogi Flautas and Nachos!
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Bulgogi Fries! (this is the half order!)

LFbfpWRuyVIb6aPwKpg2ig.text: Enjoyed the fusion tacos and burroto.  5% discount if you pay cash. Food works well.   Wull visit ecery tume in vegas.

iUimllesUD6byR64mq6WFw.text: This place has all the potential to be great. I loved in Korea for a couple years and love the food. Komex has some really great picks and some mediocre ones too. I've always enjoyed the bulgogi burrito. The kimchi fried rice is just ok. The tater tots are way too much. Fried potatoes combined with cheese, bacon, bulgogi and pork belly=3 bites and you are done. Too much grease and fat. I might be making the case for some people on those.  If you go here, stick to the classics as those seem to be the best. Some of the fusion doesn't quite work.  Bulgogi burrito though= 5 stars

FjILewCpsAYiUJ3kaPVB6A.text: While driving to the SoBe Ice Arena in the northern part of Las Vegas, my travel companion eyed KoMex. Intrigued by the name, and the concept of a fusion of Korean and Mexican cuisine, we stopped by for a quick noshing after completing our event at the rink.   There's not much going on in terms of decor or ambience in this little eatery, but those types of trivialities should be shelved; it's the food that is king at this local hotspot. KoMex has all the appearances of a neighborhood taco shop, but it really is a full service, sit-down restaurant.  Upon entry, it was refreshing to see a sign that loosely read, "This is not fast food. Expect to wait a little longer for your meal."  And that was just fine with us.  We decided to share an order of the Bulgogi Nachos. In addition, I ordered one of their shrimp tacos, while my lunching companion selected the Spicy Pork Tostada. The nachos were delicious. The distinct flavor of the bulgogi integrated nicely with the classic Mexican nacho construction. I was quite impressed. My taco was also pretty darn good, packed full of shrimp (they don't skimp, thankfully) and flavored by a delicious white sauce. Needless to say, the somewhat grumpy disposition I had developed before walking into KoMex quickly subsided after the first few bites.   Final bill was around $17. A great bargain for the ton of food that we received.  Amazing concept. Flawless execution.  If I were a local, I fear KoMex would become one of my regular haunts.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi Nachos
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi Nachos

ZLBlMAyqHTAXN476aqMxvQ.text: "hidden gem" yada yada  Been here twice, not thouroughly impressed with the food, but I would come back since they have such a creative menu.  REVIEW OF FOOD: - bulgogi torta: came out a little soggy.  YUMMMM love damp bread... NOT. But bulgogi is awesome and so are tortas. Would have been better if they could somehow contain those juices better  - kimchi fried rice + bulgogi: freakin' LARGE serving. Almost too much rice to just have as your meal. One thing, there was def NOT ENOUGH bulgogi in the rice. I had to dig around to make sure I had proportionate rice to meat ratio per bite.  - bulgogi burrito: after the semi-disappointment with the torta, the burritio was next on my list to try. It was disappointingly bland!!  I had higher expectations but I guess I built myself up too much.  - chips + avocado and salsa are complimentary  - saw someone order what looked like a chicken and white rice plate...looked pretty tasty so that's something I'd consider trying next time.   - my friend could not stop raving about the calamari taco - said the calamari was cooked to perfection and crispy. Good enough to order another one, on top of the 2 other tacos and burrito she ordered.  Not overly thrilled with the food here, but I'd go again to try a few other things on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi burrito sans cilantro...kind of bland
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge plate of kimchi fried rice

h-vO50PIfupMmhBLGgMH3g.text: I've been here several times and have nothing bad to say about it. The service is always great and the food is sooo delicious! The kimchi fried rice with the 3 meat combo is amazing...and the bulgogi Philly cheesesteak is the bomb! You can't go wrong with the spam or pork belly musubi either. Anyway, can't wait to go back for more.

TrlanC-xBImVCujXkxZAeg.text: Heard rave reviews about this place from my brother and some Yelpers.  Went with some coworkers to check it out during a Friday work lunch.  Parking lot is small and packed, had to park behind building on a side street.  Ordered the Bulgogi cheesesteak sandwich and added tater tots for an additional $1.  The cheesesteak was delicious and packed with a good amount of meat.  The fusion aspect worked well with this type of sandwich!  I also like the complimentary chips & salsa that they give you.  A few other folks in my group got the Bulgogi chimichanga and Bulgogi quesadilla..they both looked delicious too!  Overall, for the most part, I think Komex lives up to the hype, and I would definitely go back again!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesesteak sandwich...lots of meat and delicious cheese!
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi cheesesteak and tater tots..yummy!

vhiPTlOdOGxsKTyKhlFQzg.text: This place is small but their food has a lot of flavor! I had a asada quesadilla with guacamole, it was deliciously tasty! My son had chimichurri chicken, beef & pork tacos, he loved them. Great service & prices. Highly recommend! I enjoyed to the point of forgetting to take pics of our meals.

9nvmPo9t9lrmyVmBfJm_wQ.text: Great tacos, what can I say.  Always eat here whenever passing through Las Vegas....and that's about twice a month.  I found a new favorite dish there being on a Keto diet...and that's the lettuce wrap tacos.

BkcUAVEMN2jtQE6oJlNiPA.text: Yummy korean mexican food! Upon entering the store, the staff served us with a great smile and she was very friendly towards us. The meal served was delicious and it is definitely a comfort food for us especially after a long drive during the day!   Highly recommending this place!

8eg7bzOwlMU0j2g7mvviqQ.text: I've been wanting to come here after hearing so much great things about this place! I got Fusion Tator Tots and IT IS AMAZING! There's three meats combine and they all compliment each other so well. I also got four different fusion tacos with my sister and let me tell you, IT'S GOOOOOOD. I got chicken and tofu fusion tacos and I was not disappointed. The chicken was really tender and juicy, just how I like my chicken. It was full of flavors and has a small kick in different bites. The tofu taco is a good vegetarian recommendation and very filling for me. I actually like the tofu more since I'm not a meat person.   WILL BE COMING BACK TO TRY OTHER FOOD CHOICES!!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fusion Tacos with flour tortilla
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fusion Tator Tots

Tyyj4Bg7KzBQUkFLqsWsCw.text: So I heard a lot of hype going in about how great this place was, and maybe I need to give it a second chance. But for me, it was just meh. Not bad, not good, just meh. Left feeling physically full, but not completely satisfied. The service was a little inconsistent and the food took a long time to get to our table.  I might be willing to try it again but it was a lot of buildup going in without the payoff I was so hoping for.

sJnFLc2103IjrPEQIbI2dA.text: The Original KoMex Fusion! When you think of any kind of fusion it always creates plenty room for thought and taste. Mexican and Korean are in my top favorites of foods to eat so when you mix them together? You betcha I'm all here for it. I've been to both locations and I'd have to say the Flamingo/Buffalo location is my favorite.  My most recent experience was this past weekend while I was on this side of town for my nephews track meet. We all know track meets are like all day so my family and I decided we would take a break and grab some quick lunch. Since I'm not really on this side of town I had to pause for a little bit to think "What is around here to eat"? Pulled up Yelp and saw that KoMex was like 0.2 miles away and we were sold! The set up is kind of weird at this location in the matter of when you want to place a take out order. The amount of distance between the person sitting at the table behind you while ordering is so uncomfortable  Lunch order consisted of: Spam Masubi, 2 Bulgogi Sliders, Bulgogi Quesadilla,Chicken Fried Rice and KimChi Fried Rice. Everything was fantastic and I was glad to have shown my family another great place when your taste buds want two different types of foods at once! We will be back very soon.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States

itkX9B484PuVRbYiHpDwZQ.text: My husband and I love this place. We used to come here more often but a few months ago we came here and they were closed during regular business hour. There was no sign or anything on the door that said why so we thought it shut down permanently and we were beyond sad. But recently we drove by and saw that it's open and in business again. PHEW!!! What a relief!!! We of course pulled in for dinner without hesitation. My husband got a fusion chimichanga that has some sort of sweet and spicy pork, rice and beans inside, topped with a slaw and lots of cheese, covered in some delicious red sauce. I ordered their kimchi fried rice with beef and a fried egg. (Pictures are attached). Both dishes were delicious and having free chips and salsa while we waited for our food was a huge plus. The gentleman that seems to be the only one working the front is very nice and attentive. The only reason why I took a star off is because the inside is pretty small and could use some upgrades. But other than that, we love their food here and would definitely come back more regularly.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips and salsa, chimichanga and kimchi fried rice.

XlqUsolDCHzJhyubiPiHMg.text: Awesome fast service and delicious food. The guy who served us was so nice! He answered and helped me with all my questions. Even though it wasn't like a restaurant type, they gave us a free appetizer! Salsa and chips made me satisfied already. Then when food quickly came, it was perfect; it had kimchi and good meat! I ordered Kimchi fried rice and my friend ordered Fusion Sliders. If it wasn't that far, would definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kimchi fried rice
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kimchi fried rice and fusion sliders, and free appetizer chips and salsa!

0UdqRqEsw65sbogiwL1OUA.text: Food was good and came out quick! Would recommend this place to anyone if you like Korean or Mexican food!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bomb Korean food

3P4U2jZxkcXpI_pPl9Yirw.text: The food here is amazing, the shrimp tacos, the chicken the fried rice and the teriyaki chicken plate....and the "KOREAN SWEET AND SPICEY SAUCE!!!!!" OMG!!! It is honestly the best sauce I've ever had in my life, it even outside Sriracha! And let me tell you LADIES!!! "KENNY" he works mainly on the front register, he is such a cutie-pa-tu-tee!!!!!!! I believe he is single  everything about Komex is fabulous! The food, the people, the vibe! Lynda the owner is the sweetest woman ever!! There is really no place like it!! Mark my word!

rJnA2WwZS9lwwsSW-rbM8w.text: Every time I come to Las Vegas I always speak to one of my sales people and ask them what they recommend as far as food goes. This time I asked the sales person let's go somewhere that I cannot get anywhere else but here in Las Vegas.   From the outside it looks intimidating, and upon walking in I still felt the same as the decor Isn't exactly lavish. However since my friend said that this place is going to be one of my favorite places to come to, I decided to try it.  I had the sliders, and they were absolutely delicious. The food there is well prepared and the owner I believe is super nice. My coworker is correct I will be back

XCqsFv38VKXOk3vGBLJ5bg.text: Extremely generous portioned and decently priced little spot for korean-mexican fusion food. They offer 5% off your bill if you pay cash. The food is made to order, but the wait isn't long at all.  It's a perfect place for cheese lovers, because a lot of the dishes are dripping with cheese that even I.. someone who doesn't eat dairy.. was drooling at the food.  I got the kimchi fried rice, which was amazing. We also got the perfectly toasted beef grilled cheese which was so gooey and delicious. It's a small drive from the strip, but worth the trip.

PThyA-fTXc0sjMfdU0aCTw.text: I was recommended to come here by one of my friends so I brought the whole gang and we are l i v i d. The food here is amazing. It's korean + mexican fusion (duh lol) and you have the option of picking either both together or just one. I would 100% recommend going here, they really know what they're doing here and the service we received was amazing. The staff is so sweet and you seriously can't go wrong with the food here. Even the prices aren't that bad for what you're getting.   I recommend getting the chow fettucine with shrimp all the way and DEFINITELY try the tacos. Seriously. Don't forget to try these.

SwhY9Vzq4hJgemt8S7dyag.text: Excellent food! Chips and salsa were complimentary when eating there. Street tacos were very yummy and I also got a strawberry macaroon ice cream sandwich. Will def be returning.

5Cyv6aVgX1oHp9NS9wf96A.text: Awesome food! I got the bulgogi plate, rice was fluffy and the meat was delicious. My husband got it on a philly cheese steak and it looked good. Service was good and friendly.

xPMU4Ozqi84E4u9eKIYoVw.text: Still small, still family-owned, and still the best place in town for some Korean-Mexican fusion food!  Don't think I've been here in a minute...so many places in Vegas to get a bite to eat!  But the wifey was feeling nachos, and I was jonesin' for some kind of banchan when it just clicked..KoMex!!  Inside is a bit nicer now with some new chairs & tables, I think a newer TV too.  But thankfully the food is still the yummy same!  I would almost kill for that salsa/Korean hot sauce combo they use, hits all the right taste notes!  We got the Fusion Nachos with Chicken and the Fusion Quesadilla with Beef to share.  OMG - still delicious!  Nachos were full of seasoned, grilled chicken, lots of cheese & jalapenos, lots of pico, and lots of that Korean hot sauce!  Spicy & cheesy!  The quesadilla was just as good, nothing but bulgogi beef & a ton of cheese!  So enticing with the perfect crust on the tortilla from the grill!  Crisp on the outside but gooey on the inside!  No Korean drama here folks, just some damn fine eats!!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States

frQiDyiOtzjKD0WFiKXHcg.text: Korean.....Mexican??? Absolutely fantastic.  They brought chips and salsa to the table when we ordered. The salsa was very tasty.  We ordered the fusion tater tots.  This was a phenomenal. Not too much, not too little, enough for the three of us.  My brother ordered three tacos, a bulgoggi, pork belly and spicy pork.  He loved them.  Howard had the fusion cheese steak.  It was really tasty.  The bulgoggi was so delicious served this way.  I ordered the Chow noodles with the bulgoggi.  It was fresh, the noodles were lightly seasoned, the onions, peppers and cabbage sauteed to perfection.  If you are in Las Vegas, search this place out.  All food is cooked to order.  Run don't walk to try this.
