NeeaO5NArCCjIcet9fl5xw.text: Awesome food! Little hole in the wall eatery with a great tasting menu. Ordered the rice bowl with bulgogi chicken, substituted rice for stir fry veggies, upcharge, and had the kimchi on the side. Served chips and salsa before we got our food. Great crisp chips and salsa was just the right amount of heat, which is between mild and medium.   The bowl was great! Tasty tender meat, crisp greens and stir fry veggies Mmmm Mmmm good  Friend had the steak tacos and was very happy with their choice.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken bulgogi rice bowl, minus rice - add stir fry veggies.
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak tacos

LufFqCU7skEbZryYGP0www.text: We found this restaurant visiting Summerlin. The flavor of the tacos are insanely mouth watering, it's unreal!

Wgbrc8NaXsp0OksUasc7CQ.text: Not to exaggerate but I think they can open their own Chipotle style KoMex food chain, because oh em gee, fusion cuisine never tasted so good baby. Can't believe I live only five minutes away from this place! Everything was mouthwatering and caught me by surprise since other fusion places I've been only taste blaaaaand. But food here? They got all the rich flavors you've been craving. They also make their own four different styles of Korean-Mexican sauces, and they are DELICIOUS!! One is Siracha based, one is green chili based and one is a Korean sauce. Once you pour that red sauce onto your burrito, and bite into the beans, the beef, the pico, the onion and the rice. You're taken to a whole other world. The burrito itself is hefty huge. Every bite hits the spot! They also offer macaron ice cream sandwiches, can I just ask for anything better? Will definitely be back again. Additionally, the PRICE is cheap, SERVICE is fast and PORTIONS are great. KoMex you rock.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States

58oEbhkKTZKInppdpRCXiA.text: I found the food terrible. The food was very bland, dry and left you wanting something else. Nothing Korean or Mexican about it.... I expected great flavor from a fusion place. The dining area is also somewhat dirty.

enkv55DVwflguTbVOu0zng.text: Oh....my god. I'm usually super skeptical about "fusion" foods because they often seem to be a shortcut for claiming creativity and innovation in cuisine. But. KoMex is the real deal -- freaking fabulous Korean-and-Mexican-influenced food that is executed absolutely perfectly. The dishes themselves seem sooo standard (omg fried rice and nachos, how quaint) but that is seriously misleading. They will be the most amazing fried rice and nachos that will ever grace your unworthy tastebuds and there will be enough portioned on your plate to serve a medium-to-large family (pace yourself).  The location is vaguely sketch and sort of random, to the point that I drove by it three times searching for a likely storefront -- don't make this mistake, it *is* in that plaza that looks straight out of the Walking Dead.

VU1d848nnfqT1rYEFcj_Jw.text: We just beat the rush, but the line can get pretty long. We saw it build up while we were there.  Korean and Mexican fusion. Sounds a little weird right? Maybe, but the food is good!!! I'm not as high on it as some of the other Yelpers,  but I still put it pretty high on my list.  So what's actually pretty awesome about this place is that they have ZERO problem splitting checks for you. Unlike other places that say they will but give you this reluctant only-if-I-get-a-good-tip attitude, our server split up our party of 12 with NO problem. Go in, eat,  pay your bill, bounce. You don't have to sit there for 30 minutes trying to figure out what everyone ordered and how much they owe for tip.  Bulgogi Burrito ($7.50) Pretty huge burrito. I had to split because it was too big. The bulgogi portion is plenty, which is always nice. However, the taste of the bulgogi wasn't anything spectacular to me, just "pretty good".  The tacos were pretty popular at our table, so I'd definitely recommend getting that.

ePKNf8Xv7MPb90oUrV6MQQ.text: The nachos are so good!!!!!  This is our go to restaurant anytime out of towners are visiting.  The service is excellent.  Bulgogi!!!

iOiZ6-ShWQHWqXc1RCIrvQ.text: Service was awesome! Although at the time we ate there was only 1 other table there. We were served really quick and our drinks kept getting refilled,  We had the kimchi fried rice with bulgogi, fusion tacos (bulgogi, fish, and shrimp). Bomb! Well priced too. Definitely coming back! Burp.

LjcaCKovBmdHzBf1qJc1gA.text: We traveled to KoMex from the southwest side due to all the great Yelp reviews of this place.  I really love the infamous Kogi taco truck in L.A. and have tried to replicate the Korean fusion tacos at home to no avail.  Once we heard about this place, I knew we had to go immediately.  This mom and pop shop has modest decor, but is still comfortable.  A lot of that has to do with the wonderful service from the owners... I didn't catch her name, but one of the owners was so nice and honest!  Since it was our first visit there, we were going to order too much food - and she told us that it might be too much for us since their portions are big.  I really liked the sincerity - you would never find that anywhere else!  Anyway, we ordered a bunch of the bulgogi tacos and also the Korean style pork with rice.  This was more than enough food for two people.  The tacos were DELICIOUS and dare I say better than the Kogi truck.  The pork was awesome.  Period.  I'd eat that same meal over again anytime!  I also have to mention the complimentary chips and salsa (and guac!) for dine in.  Its tasty and free, can't go wrong!  I mentioned to the owner how much I love Chop Chae (this Korean noodle dish)... and although they didn't have it on their menu, she said that they could special cook it for us if we let her know in advance.  How nice!  Their menu is huge and includes the Korean fusion Mexican, regular Mexican, and Chinese dishes.  Their prices are outstanding... actually unbelievable in my opinion for the quality and taste of the food you get.  I think we ended up paying 12 bucks for the rice dish and 5 tacos.  12  bucks?!  Nice.  We are definitely going to make this a regular spot.  Looking forward to trying everything on their menu!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kimchi fried rice
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef chow mein
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi tacos and korean pork with rice.  Delicious!

q2CQrItNSt-1P1fi79azcA.text: My wife heard about this place on Yelp and really wanted to try it. So we ventured over last weekend. I am glad we did!  This is one of the best Korean/Mexican fusion places I have been to. WAAAY better than Hanshik taco and maybe even better than the famous Kogi trucks in L.A.  We got the chicken, beef, and pork fusion tacos. We got the chicken in a lettuce wrap and the other two in a corn tortilla. We also ordered the bulgogi burrito. Everything was great. I preferred the tacos, but that has a lot to do with the fact that I'm not a big fan of rice in my burritos.  I plan to be a regular customer.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fusion tacos

P9yQer1-c_Oc-NFQViH3uw.text: Had the bulgogi Tator tots and thought they were pretty good.  Tots were crispy and well flavored.  Prices are reasonable...definitely worth a try

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States

41f9dL9Adnl74WZG2zn6NQ.text: Finally my family and I tried this place. We had bulgogi enchilada, bulgogi fries, and chicken wings. All was super delicious. The staff was friendly too.  The only downside was the place is not in the best area and is small with few tables. Like another said It's what you call a "hole in the wall" but it is worth trying.

gkcz9NNyxx8ezeYZMGRPbA.text: A small little dive with incredible food!  Mexican and American dishes with Korean flair.  When you walk in your expectations are not high, Michael Jackson's Thriller playing in background, older tv in corner with ESPN on...open kitchen with small seating area, typical of an older strip mall layout. You are greeted at door by cook and staff, and service starts as soon as you sit down, Chips with salsa and guacamole served with drinks. and food is prepared to order and fast. Many higher end restaurants could take a tip from these folks. We had Sliders with Korean BBQ meat and asian slaw, Masubi (spam, egg and rice roll) and Bulgogi nachos. All were delicious and would be considered high end tapas at double the price in a large trendy place. Serving sizes large, prices very reasonable for quality.

lKBMXrB6bRYAu560dhwjAQ.text: Wow.  We paid $9.13 for 2 meals, 2 cans of Coke Zero, complimentary housemade fried tortilla chips with guacamole & salsa, and complimentary oranges & fortune cookies for dessert.  It was so cheap, the service so nice, the staff just a mom/pop/daughter, and the food was so delicious that it made us feel bad...so we dropped a 20 dollar bill and let them keep the change.  I've only had Korean-Mexican fusion tacos done to perfection once before - at Coreanos in Austin, TX.  While a slightly different fusion mix, KoMex was definitely just as amazing.  I grew up on Mexican food (and cook it often fused with Vietnamese food), but I have to say that the sweetness in Korean marinades really works the best in fusion tacos.  We tried the special "diablo" chicken, spicy pork, and beef (bulgogi) fusion tacos, with kimchi included on the side.  The fillings for the $1.29 tacos are more on the Mexican side of things, while the fillings for the large burritos are more on the Korean side.  3 tacos is enough for a meal, as they certainly didn't skimp on the meat and fillings.  As for which I liked best, I'd have to say the spicy pork, which tasted very similar to the diablo chicken.   The tacos came with a sauce rack of 3 sauces (Mexican, Korean, Chinese) - all of them obviously housemade.  The "Mexican" sauce tasted a lot like the raw earthniess of freshly-ground New Mexican red chiles or similar, just like the sauce used at Mexican taquerias.  When dabbed onto the tacos, this raw earthiness just blended away and mixed into the sweetness of the meat.  The "Korean" sauce looked like your typical Korean hot bean paste, but one taste and I realized how much better it was than any brand I've had in a jar/bottle.  The "Chinese" sauce had chunks of garlic, chiles, and scallions in it, with a little bit of a soy sauce flavor in the base.  All were awesome - not being able to make up my mind, I spooned some on each bite, sometimes mixing 2 or 3 of them together.  Man, if I only had a Korean-Mex place as good as this in DC -- I'd seriously be there almost every day for lunch. I am salivating dreaming about it.  This place would also *clean up* in the Atlas District.  We told our waitress all about it and the ridiculousness of Toki Underground and its wait/overpriced ramen, who then relayed our stories to her parents in the kitchen.  People would eagerly pay $10 for these $3.87 plates of tacos, and wait 2 hours for it.  And then you could charge $8 for a cocktail on top of that.  C'mon, move out here -- there is a huge Korean community here in the 'burbs!  :)  Best food I had in Vegas (okay, so maybe Lotus of Siam was a tie - pun not intended) while I was there all last week.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So much food.  Only $9.13 for 2.  We felt bad and gave them $20.
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EzmYJqTcTXYUyJuGkGQ30Q.text: Mind is completely blown. Korean, Mexican, Chinese fusion?? HELL YEAH!  I found this little place randomly on our way out of Vegas after a weekend trip. I searched yelp by check in offers because I was feeling cheap after losing all my money on the strip. KoMex came up, and we were sold. In fact, we waited in the parking lot for over an hour until they opened just so we could try it.   We over-ordered and everything was so inexpensive. I had the shrimp stir fry, my boyfriend had the bulgogi nachos, my friend had kimchi fried rice and they ordered a bulgogi burrito with kimchi as well. Everything I tried was amazing. I ordered a double order of kimchi on the side and greedilt gobbled it up in less than a minute.  The people working there were super nice and the food came out quickly. Plus, free wontons when you check in. Can't beat that!

ndPTWp2o0XnnHGN1ij5xFQ.text: Gosh, after hearing and reading so many great reviews about Komex, we decided to stop by for lunch after 90 mins of pilates/yoga. It was quite a distance(22+ mins) and in the hood, but was worthed. We were quite excited to see on the item of the week board "4 tacos for $5, fusion/Mexican".  This is a great deal to sample different tacos.   My friend, Patty, and I each got the - bulgogi: this taco reigned supreme by Patty and I.  Unique and delish. We put the Chinese hot sauce/salsa on this baby and got ourselves a flavorful and tantalizing heaping of greatness.  -asada: top this off with the Mexican salsa...good, but My taste bud could not forget the bulgogi - carnita: oh how the pork was kinda crispy...I forgot about the bulgogi taco for a nano-second -pollo:  I was full when I came to this taco. So I tried a piece of the chicken. Can't stack this up against the aforementioned three. Earl finished this taco for me.  We also tried the spam musubi. Portion was big. Was alright.   I had a taste of the bulgogi burrito and it was very yummy with the Kim chi in it. Like what every other yelpers have mentioned, the burrito is gianormous.  It has value written all over it.   Additionally, the Kim chi was super delicious.   There isn't much decor and the seats were not the most comfy seats, but after eating the food, I forgot about it.   We really wanted to try the pork taco on the fusion but they ran out of it. Boo. I was really excited to try that one too. Has to be for next time then.

UDxGoCbB3OU6MNv3RcHYFQ.text: This place serves heaven on a plate!!!!  The food is so good and fresh.  It's such a small hole in the wall restaurant but that's what I love about it.  It's still a nice and humble establishment.  It's always been very clean every time I went and the staff is always really pleasant.  Just wish this restaurant wasn't so far away from me in the Southwest area because if it were closer i'd be there EVERY day for lunch AND dinner hahaha.  I tell everyone I know about this place because it's so worth going to.

bngbCQt8qCpooXrms68RJA.text: I know I'm going to hear crap for only giving this place 3 stars. The food here is outstanding!!!! But service, that's a completely different story. Been here about 3 times and have had not so great service every single time.  First time, made the mistake of coming during lunch time. Wait was about 45 minutes but luckily I had nothing planned after and was looking forward to trying a new place. After almost an hour we finally had a table. And after 30 minutes, finally got our food. It was very busy so I understand the wait. Second time, I called in my order since I only had 30 minutes for lunch. Said it would be ready in 20. Got there, still had to wait 20 minutes for my food. The order had not even been started yet. Third visit, came here today with my boss. Came around 1:30 after the lunch rush. They weren't very busy but we felt like they were rushing us to get out. There wasn't even anyone waiting for a table. So yeah, long story short...service is lacking. They have picked up on hiring extra staff which is good.  On the other hand, food is amazing!!!! The bulgogi burrito is my #1 choice. The mix of Korean and Mexican flavors all rolled into one is mind blowing!!! This is probably what unicorns eat since it's super amazing. If you're feeling like a health nut, they offer the same taste in a lettuce taco. Not really healthy if you eat 4 of them though. The portions are huge and the price is affordable! Since I'm close by, I will be back.

cvaytVeryyHLxh2bP0SyAw.text: Komex Fusion is doing big things in Las Vegas. The creation of Korean, Mexican, Chinese, and American infused dishes is pure genius. When I hear of great places to eat...I am on my way! Hidden in a small mini mall, I found food greatness! Today was my first time eating Komex Fusion and I will admit, it's the best taco I had in about 5 years. Yes...5 long years. Of course, I didn't just eat a taco...lol. The wontons-Spicy beef and pork, stuffed inside a wonton wrapper and deep fried, served with a spicy dipping sauce! The Bulgogi Fusion Burrito-Thinly sliced spiced beef, Mexican Rice, Green and Brown Onions, Pico de gallo, and Cheese, wrapped inside a fresh flour tortilla shell. The meat is seasoned to perfection, I really have no words, it's so good, it shut my mouth! Lastly, but not least, the Bulgogi Beef Tacos is it! Spicy Meat, cabbage slaw, melty cheese. They taste like it was marinated in Korean spices, then cooked on the flat top, creating little bites of crispy, tender, joys of beef!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican Enchilada Plate with Beef, Chicken, and Pork, Magically Delicious!
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Teriyaki Chicken fit for a king...this is a full order, next time I will be getting a half order...that was a lot of food.
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Crispy Chicken Wings...delicious!

3g-mlDFBdXX0GSzraDhjzw.text: Food was pretty good I got bulgogi fries I wish the fries were a little crunchier and there needed to be more meat on it. Chicken taco didn't have as much flavor as I hoped but my boyfriend got the shrimp taco and that was delicious

V1skC2nrAyhjQcb0VjsM8Q.text: I checked out KoMex the other day.  I got the kim chi fried rice with chicken.  It was saucy and spicy and in a way...comforting.  It was nice to remove myself from the hustle from the Strip and sit down in a nice little hole in the wall restaurant.  I also tried the burrito.  It basically was any other burrito that I would have gotten at a mexican restaurant, but with bulgogi.  I kind of wish there was a sauce to go with it though.  The crew is really nice and attentive.

rHbgrqdPIuCauOfjsrsP8w.text: Found this restaurant on yelp.  Based on reviews decided to give it a try. The service was excellent the food was of high quality. The presentation was nice the flavors were outstanding.  We enjoyed the smothered fries the flauta' and the crispy rice and then sampled the fried wontons. everything was done extremely well. Prices are very reasonable and I would highly recommend this restaurant.   The food is prepared fresh everything was done to perfection. You may have to wait since the food is fresh and prepared when ordered.   Customer service is excellent. Food presentation is very appealing. I could see this restaurant growing if it had a bigger floor plan.

M66eORETLcgQaA-97myuag.text: Excellent.  Perfect hole in the wall experience.  We got the Bulgogi Taters and the Rice Bowl.  Loved them.  The tater tots were so crunchy and delicious and the rice bowl was packed with kimchi flavor.  Even the chips and salsa here were great.  Some of the best chips I've ever had.

VnJ75sPdEfrvFdiR8TjyHA.text: Ohmygosh. That bulgogi chimichanga??! Incredible. I wish I had not discovered that. It's way better than it has a right to be. Now I crave it. Tried to save half for another meal. Couldn't do it! Get in my belly! (mouth is watering, dammit!)

2ThqQs4rACfmri-pn1uuNw.text: Everything here is delicious and the prices a very cheap. We saw this place in yelp and I knew I had to have it. The first time there we ordered the fusion tacos and the fusion tostadas which are made with rice patties. Both of these items tasted heavenly and we have definitely been back to that place time and time again. If you are a food fanatic this is the place for you. ENJOY!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fusion tostadas
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fusion Tacos in tortillas and lettuce!

h28PF3uegQJ0PpYbMqMesw.text: Amazing food!!! Love how they mix things up and really friendly owner. A+ restaurant. Always eat here at least 3x a week on my lunch break. Great serving of food. Will recommend to everyone...

kzAWH4I7iUu5nePX6KhY3A.text: Not only is the food great but the service is amazing. Anytime I have a Mexican craving I know where I'm going. Side note: too anyone that is claustrophobic, the place is a bit tiny so you might wanna order too go.

m1dKgQNZ1PjoU5-gooYqTA.text: After much searching for this place the bf and I finally went! A tiny little hole in the wall tucked inside of a very bland string of other businesses. Barely noticeable from the street, I wonder if I would ever have run into this place if on my own!  Walking in, the lime green walls and "older" furniture left me wondering what kind of boyfriend I had and whether I should turn and run. Thank goodness I didn't! We were seated immediately and given drinks and fresh guac and salsa. The chips tasted freshly fried and delish!   I was weary about the fusion type. Can these two foods REALLY go together? Are my beans going to run into my kimchi and vice versa? I left my worrying aside as I ordered the fusion burrito. I chose chicken to be safe. The bf had bulgogi tacos. Our food arrived pretty quickly. My eyes grew huge when I saw my burrito! WTF?!?! The thing was gigantic!!! When I opened it up and started to eat I paused after the first bite. HOW DAMN DELICIOUS! The thing was too big to finish and I regretted having a big lunch before stopping here for dinner! haha! The marinated meat was better than I had at more expensive restaurants with nicer decor, etc. The tacos were great too. I just had to steal a bite. The meat was soft and cooked just right. Not overcooked or rubbery as we've had in other fast food places. The people working were so sweet and checked on us often.   Towards the end of our meal when I thought I could not fit in another bite, our server came up to us with half a sliced orange and two fortune cookies. It was a very sweet gesture. Free dessert AND a palate cleanser! ha! The perfect touch to a great dinner!

aarqYi9WtMyiqXLDXIg1qQ.text: Pretty good! Great prices! The best thing about this place is the fact that there is nothing else like it. I was very surprised with how well they blended the flavored of Mexican and Korean. Probably will not be back unless I want to show a friend but it was good.

na08MkGWGsSL3cbsnnFiRQ.text: I've read so much about this place and finally decided to go after work today, and wow I was impressed!  Other reviewers talked about how there's a wait, but when I got there at around 2:30 (prime lunch hour) there were only two other parties there! I was seated promptly, given my beverage, a menu and complimentary tortilla chips, guacamole and pico de gallo.   I ordered the Bulgogi Nachos and wow, if I had known the servings were so huge I would've just had a half order! The prep for my food didn't take very long, maybe 10mins tops and it was delicious. The bulgogi in the nachos were generous and were strayed all over the top along with some pico de gallo and jalapenos. The bulgogi itself was marinated to a balanced sweet and saltiness that it almost made me want to order something else that had more of it.   The waitresses constantly refilled my water and were very nice. The price for my entire meal was very generous and the service was all together very pleasant.   Next time I will definitely be trying the other fusions on the menu (mmm pork belly tacos).   If you haven't had the chance to try fusion food made right I'd definitely recommend you pay a visit to this place! Just be sure to call ahead of time to reserve tables if you have a fairly large party, the place itself is very small and I could imagine it getting filled very quickly.

ITGvpHzysBYE90mGFQAXXA.text: Wow!!! Yelpers are right! This place is good.  We flew into Vegas from Atl and this place is quite close to the airport, about a 15 minute drive.  And the food is so good! We had the fusion tacos in all three flavors. My dad liked the Korean hot sauce cuz it's sweet. But I liked the Chinese hot sauce, so many layers of flavor.  The hostess was very sweet and amiable and the owner came out to talk to us and tell us about how Komex came to be and how they've been growing in large part thanks to Yelp.

M03A4DtRm6x8ODQPxNFBAQ.text: Good food for good prices! Everything tastes good... I find it so weird that they are closed on Mondays.

IsAxD4eaMiP_9J-8s9B2sA.text: I was pretty disappointed in the place after reading son many good reviews and hearing so many good things about the place. I for one wasn't impressed at all. Everything was so so. We ordered the chicken flautas, spicy bulgogi chimichanga, bulgogi enchiladas, quesadilla, and pork belly tacos. The pork belly tacos were the stand out. I would order that again, the rest, just ordinary for me. Not great korean food and not so great mexican food combined....just ok.

60LzLdxyxqbi1Xj_66oPeA.text: I have had one 5 star visit here and one 1 star visit, so the average is 3 stars.  First time was great!  Our waiter was a Bonanza High School student who was so charming and friendly.  He gave us some free guac because we told him it was our first time there.  I got the Fusion Burrito, which was surprisingly delicious, and my husband got the orange chicken.  The staff was really friendly and we talked with the owner about how she wants to open another location.  I had been itching to go back since then and we went last night.  Now, they had just opened up again after being on Christmas vacation, so I don't know if that is why it was so crazy in there,  but our second experience wasn't as good.  It was very crowded at 8:00 on a Wednesday night. My husband wanted the orange chicken again, but they had taken it off the menu.  He was really disappointed by that.  I ordered the carne de puerco. Unfortunately, the meat was cold and the rice and beans looked like they were from a can.  The owner was the only one waiting tables this time, so she was super frazzled.  I like this place and I like the lady who owns the restaurant, so I'll definitely be back, but my last visit definitely moved them down a few notches for me.

WdO_yFAiHgAIZp0COm4pyQ.text: What can I say about a place that provides intensely flavorful treats at an affordable price; FINALLY!  When you enter the door the restaurant is plain, nothing over the top, just comfortable and intimate. We were seated and brought drinks and free chips and salsa with homemade guacamole. Who does that? How awesome! We then were told about the $5 special that was 3 bulgogi tacos and a drink. It's less than eating McDonalds, but quality food. I cannot say enough nice things about what we ate or the service. For the first time in my life after eating we ordered 2 more specials and a plate of fried rice to go to eat for dinner. Such an awesome experience.

3GAbi17ptsPkvAhN0msBlQ.text: Let's make this short and simple... I walked in and the young man at the door said no dine ins due to a big party that was coming. He said take out only... We agreed  this other rude man said to order on the counter but the way he said it and went about it was so demanding. He reminded me of a C.O in prison... We didn't even sit down and eat because customer service was so horrible. With that said.... Screw Komex fusion and all it's rudeass employees!

RlU4yls2rNq746cWP8tezw.text: We found this place via yelp and didn't know what to expect. We walked in the door and found a good size line and little seating, which didn't bode well for my wife and I as she was 9 months pregnant, but out of sheer kindness this couple Rachael her husband two kids and her sister asked us to join them at a thier  table and eat with them, my wife didn't hesitate. We place our order and proceed to have a great time talking with out table mates, and drooling over what they ordered. After a while our order arrived, steaming hot and excellent, I ordered the combo bulgogi (chicken & pork) WOW it had the perfect amount of spice (for me) and both the chicken and pork we moist and tender, my wife's fusion tacos were equally good,again the beef and chicken were moist, tender, a perfectly cooked. After we said good bye to the very kind couple, the owner came out (she took our order) and asked how our meal was, and apologized for the wait, to which myself and my wife told her not to apologize at all everything was wonderful and that we had an amazing time. Overall the experience was outstanding, the food excellent the price point spot on and to the couple that let us sit with them THANK YOU!

LVLN3_jjoKd50RWyYYQsLw.text: My overall experience at this restaurant was fantastic. I had the Bulgogi Burrito and it was phenomenal. Great tasting, fresh ingredients. The customer service was above-and-beyond what I have experienced from other restaurants. Very attentive and friendly.   Also, the staff mentioned the possibility of another satellite location opening on the south end of town. Yes!

ey3wpKObKrYFQJMn0nsSEw.text: KoMex' fusion dishes are a little bit of a head scratcher. From what we ordered, they seemed largely like Mexican dishes with very little Korean going on outside Kimchi. The food was all solid, with the pork belly and fish tacos being the two standouts, but I was expecting more fusion and creativity going on. KoMex is very good quick (Don't call it fast!) food at cheap prices, in a bare bones setting, and a friendly staff.

4BuPph53SsvqoXO7So6aRg.text: We went to Komex this trip...had to try the new location on Buffalo because the Decauter location was closed on Sunday....EVERY bit as wonderful and it was so hard to leave.  GREAT news is they sell their sweet/spicy Koren hotsauce by the pound, so will have to bring a leak proof container when we visit the kid again in April!!!  Woooo-Wooo....book a nonstop flight and do the same....SO worth it!!!  Had the Bulgogi nachos and our normal corn tortilla tacos...my sister, the pickiest eater EVER could NOT stop singing their praises!!!  She was even telling folks on the plane about them!!!  Thanks again Komex for the BEST dining experience our entire trip (and we enjoyed some world class cuisine!)  Will be back in April for sure!!!! PS....PLEASE publish a cook book for those of us that live in other states and are in NEED of a KoMex experience!!!!  ;)

Dq2U57sxRzEOr2ntlvJmCA.text: Affordable, filling and amazing service?! Yes please! I have only been coming in since the start of the year. I had been hearing about this place from other students from school and wanted to see what the "hype" is all about. If you want affordable food with the quality to match, this is the place to go. I bring my friends with "big appetites" and they leave satisfied without burning a hole through their pockets. I myself, am I big fan of the Mexican taquitos, lettuce wraps, fusion tacos (try their pork belly fusion tacos!) and the bulgogi fried rice. Everyone is incredibly nice and it keeps me coming back! (maybe more than I should). If you have not tried KoMex, try it once! You won't regret it :)

D8zTyGm2QV3lIDie_YZb9g.text: Great service, great food!  What a unique blend of flavors and artistic interpretation.  Best burrito I've ever had!  Fired Kimchi unbelievable!  Keep up the good work!

gQVLK9Vsi8Q1iCB786Z7Tw.text: This was our second visit for this vacation trip. We found Komex a few years ago on Yelp and have gone back every time we visit Vegas.  I tried the chicken fusion lettuce wraps with kimchi. Very good...I love the red hot sauce on the table.  Can't wait to try the 2nd restaurant that will be opening later this year.

1DqGO7pQVesHooa9G4ylGA.text: LOVE KOMEX!  I always order the bulgolgi fries and spam kimchee fried rice!  Their kimchee fried rice is the best Ive ever had!  The owners are super nice and take good care of their customers.

zoxfmsaMoan1xs_YMpPA7g.text: Service: The owner was very sweet and attentive. I ordered the kimchi fried rice w/o eggs; when it came out I noticed it had small pieces of what I thought may have been eggs in the mix. I let her know I am allergic to eggs and she gladly took it back to make sure that it was made w/o eggs and reassured me that a new one would be made. The chef came out and confirmed that there were no eggs in the fried rice... so I dug in. It was delicious. so flavorful. and exploding w. kimchi!!   I also got the free fried wontons for the check in special on yelp. The owner returned to inform me that the wontons were sealed w/ egg yolk. This just showed me how attentive she was! thumbs up to that.   Boyfriend got the soft tacos in pork, chicken, and beef. The chicken taco was delicious!! It had different dressings than that of a tacoshop ie cabbage.   I was really skept about trying this restaurant when my boyfriend suggested it. But it completely opened my mind to fusion food. I've had other fusion foods in San Diego which did not compared!! Will definitely be going back! I love it when hole in the wall restaurants blow you away like this one (:

mzBLeZ5VmjL2WeB5JPmmIg.text: What a great idea to fuse Korean and Mexican. The atmosphere is very relaxed, its looks kind of divish, but the food is so good. You cant go wrong with any of the tocos, I wish they would open one on the South side of town.

hgqaM_hjanYQW-5sJYn_BA.text: I've been here twice and it's okay. Service is super slow. Nothing stood out in my opinion.

YTA09q-3LSpw3TdgNPEFtA.text: I met one of the owners , she was very welcoming and has a great smile. The fish taco was tasty, so was the spicy pork taco I dined in, so received the chips salsa and Guacamole all very good. The owner gave me a free second helping of the Guac and a free sample bowl of a seafood soup they are experimenting with and thinking of selling, it had kimchee and seafood lt was like a fusion of Mexican seven seas and spicy cabbage soup my tasty buds where whirling in confusion hehe.

q6M2vbVV0BaYXswa4f5dTg.text: I did tacos which were cool.  Fusion fries not a big fan of. The tacodilla was good. And shrimp taco was outstanding. A little hole in the wall. Glad I tried though.

QD5Hlqy-1q-931jYDjMYXQ.text: The Korean/Mexican fusion thing has been popular for a couple of years now. Some places do it better than others, and KoMex definitely does it right. If you are new to KoMex fusion just remember to keep an open mind. The experience is not like going to a great tacorilla, nor is it like going to a nicer Korean restaurant. It's different, but delicious. The wife and I always order way too much food trying to sample as many dishes as possible. But just like Chief Lone Watie, we always "Endeavor to persevere." youtube.com/watch?v=csEz... Today Tacodillas were on special. Kind of a taco inside of a quesadilla. Fantastic! Bulgogi Tacos came next. Also absolutely delicious. And we finished up the night with the massive Bulgogi Nachos. A great meal, with drinks, all for about $16.

sSzoKdBQlU2DvNurOHxCFQ.text: Food is okay. Salsa and guacamole was yummy! Their bathroom is really dirty tho. I wouldnt be surprised if they will be on dirty dining soon.

DbIDc5fRDwb692Hfe_cDnw.text: Interesting menu.  Definitely something neat.  I think it got a bit built up from what I heard.  It's really between and a 3 and a 4 star for me, but I think the uniqueness of the place and the pretty good prices give it a 4 star.  I'm interested in trying some other food from here and see what else I may like.

1nPxTtONYvTdFLGTI4xRkw.text: Where is the 10 star rating????  I have been to komex but none of my friends have, because we do not live around there. BUT it IS so worth the drive!!! I took my friend after a day of shopping. I think she was a little freaked out by the sketchy hood. I ordered a bunch of different things to share. Wonton soup, flautas, musubi, tacos, fish tacos and a torta to go for hubby. All that plus tax and tip was $40.  Sooooo much food!!!! It was ALL fantastic.  Besides the TERRIFIC food, I like that you can get a variety of different things. I had never had musubi, cuz I hate spam, but it was good. But then I am able to get the Mexi food that hubby so loves. It is PERFECT! I wish I lived closer, LOL.

jbPEM6HbOzJUXHzzmJhV2g.text: Good food, good service,  food cooked to order, can't go wrong with any choices and price is reasonable. One downside is they don't have  TO GO menu you have to go on the internet to look at the menu to order.

reAouio8vjjjwWz1vYytRw.text: Loved the idea to combine these two types of food!  Bulgogi on nachos and burritos? Genius!  Taste was pretty good and had a great hole in the wall feel.

-gsm1HeZqzi_UmZkTPVlqQ.text: Surprisingly good. Very good actually! I ordered the bulgogi tacos just to taste it. The tacos were excellent. Also ordered the bulgogi fries, the bugolgi fries were tasty but I could've done without the jalapenos. And I requested a side order of Kim Chee which was laughable due to the portion size. I will return. All in all, very good!

qfaw8GHbG1UBkyHtw5ef-Q.text: My friend Janet and I loved our meal here. The ingredients were fresh and properly prepared The food is distinctive. And it's cheap. What's not to love? For our meal we both got wontons and I got beef, pork and chicken tacos. We split a beef tostada. While the chicken and pork were both good, the beef is the star here. And it was fantastic on the fusion tostada. The tostada has great, fresh toppings but instead of a corn or flour tortilla it came on something made out of rice. and the whole rice grains were still visible. I think any trip here should include a fusion tostada. Janet tried a tofu taco since her husband is a pescetarian and she said it was quite good too.  The only misfire for me was the mango/passionfruit iced tea. I don't get the flavors. Janet got one too and said she liked it. Service was excellent. They were really hustling. We got there just before the lunch rush. I would love to come back to KoMex and explore the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef, chicken and pork tacos
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef tostada

2NHnVE6TQQOY0hkMUl0U8Q.text: What do you get when your Korean BBQ makes sweet love to a burrito? KoMex Fusion Express. This place is 5 stars hands down.   We were in the neighborhood and we've yet to experience the wonders of Korean-Mexican fusion so we stopped in. Our expectations were high and this place did not let us down. When we sat down, we were given chips with delicious guacamole and salsa. While the chips were made from flour tortillas, I preferred it because they were light and crispy. We asked for water and they gave us (free) Kirkland water bottles! YES! I am a water connoisseur and this place is handing out perfectly purified bottled water to accompany our meal.   I ordered the bulgogi burrito while my husband had a  bulgogi and pork taco. When my burrito came out, my jaw dropped. You know how Chipotle isn't known for amazing food, but rather the size of their mediocre burritos? This place would blow Chipotle's baby burritos away, and it was only $4.50!!! The bulgogi was marinated deliciously and was accompanied by pico, rice, lettuce, and kimchi. Honestly, when I eat KBBQ, I usually don't even get bulgogi because I'd rather eat Galbi, but this bulgogi in my burrito was amazingly tender and flavorful. 5 star worthy right there.  Then the super nice owner/waitress brings out the oranges that you'd get at a sushi joint with some fortune cookies and a lollipop for my daughter. Our total: $7.57. I am SO impressed with this place and will tell everybody I know to support them so that they can expand to somewhere closer to my house. Until then, I will happily make the drive.

d9Bv9gqINA3JdtTFfIv5IA.text: Short: Surprisingly great fusion place. Reasonable prices, great flavor, in an older part of town.  Long: Came here with a friend. Ordered three tacos with the three types of meat (there are more, for extra). Came with cabbage slaw and some "salsa" on top (not spicy, but wouldn't call it pico-de-gallo). Afterward, was served chips with salsa and guacamole (kinda watered down, though).  Food was great. All the meats had strong flavor, the slaw on top contrasted with them nicely. I think I liked the beef best (forgot which one was which). What really surprised me was the side-sauces that were a real treat for someone like me. Nice touch. You do pay a small premium though. $2 for each taco is a bit much when they're not full sized, as you can get around the same size in other places for $1.25/75.   Come here if you want to try a different spin on mexican food. There's better places out there, but not as unique as this one.

8dOA4ebaM89LYJEUyt7lCQ.text: Great hidden spot in Las Vegas!  I come from a Korean and Mexican background so this place was perfect for me.  The Bulgogi, marinated beef, burrito is a all time great and is an automatic go to dish for around $5 and can usually feed you for two meals.  Another recommended item is the Daegi bulgogi, spicy pork, french fries.    For those of you that have hit Robertos Tacos late night and enjoyed their super carne asada fries you will love these.  They step it up every week with new specials such as calamari tacos and bulgogi gyros so you never get bored with the menu.  The Korean street tacos blend the tastyness of Korean meats with the ease  of tacos, I recommend ordering a few at the low price of $1.29.  I could go on forever on the best items on the menu so head over and decide for yourself.  If you have friends that aren't too adventurous or little kids Komex can handle that too.  They offer sliders, french fries and other basics that are just as good.  Because this place is so good and really affordable it can get busy around peak times so don't get frustrated and recognize that if there are tons of people eating there then it must be good.

evYGjIg5yEWqol0XjvfI9g.text: Went for a quick lunch.   Not to be missed.   Had the beef bulgogi nachos.   They are fantastic.   The hot sauces they give you are some of the best I have had.   Also had 3 tacos,  the calamari is fantastic,  a must try.   Two people ate for 13 dollars.

kUZWBVZvhWuC8TWUg5AYyA.text: AMAZING!!!   I was referred here by a friend and at first thought "Korean and Mexican?? WEIRD... i dont know"... but my husband and I were in the area and thought why not, lets try it... after my friend had nothing but great things to say about this place. We tried the chimichanga and it was ABSOLUTELY AMAZING.... We actually did 1/2 chicken 1/2 beef (have you EVER been to a place that will make a burrito half and half? i havent!) The meat has fantastic flavor. I'm not a beef girl but i'd order a whole plate of their beef - its that good. The chimichanga was HUGE enough for both of us to share it (and my husband also had a beef taco which also was delicious) and we were FULL and it was $11 total with drinks. YOu cant beat that.  THe service was great. The server was so nice and attentive- you could tell she was the owner.   The only thing I'd change is their chips they serve. They were burnt, too thick and kind of bland but their salsa is great. And lets face it, i'm fat so I we ate two baskets anyway so they cant be that bad. lol  All in all, food was delicious, A LOT of food for cheap, great prices, great service great flavor. Hell even my burps taste delicious. Bahaha!

ZwjdmfJUw8ioBmZocw4O4g.text: I overheard my coworkers talking about this place and they were raving about it. I invited my husband to try it since we happened to be on that side of town and I'm so glad we checked it out! Yes, it's a small place and yes, it's a "dive", but the food is great and the service, even better. We've eaten there twice now and haven't had a bad experience. My personal favorite is the Bulgogi (Beef) Tostada. They use a crispy rice cake to host a slaw and meat. It's the perfect combination of sweet and spicy. I personally love their menu and will continue to dine there. I can't wait to check out their new location!

9slKT_Br3-q-WcQ1tuD9SA.text: In from out of town and discovered this jewel of a restaurant. The fusion of Korean and Mexican cuisines is  phenomenal. It was like a party in my mouth. I strongly recommend that everyone give it a try. You will not be disappointed!!!   L. Fenton

wAxN0EXA5MgPTe_3G74lOw.text: Went here on a recommendation from a local Las Vegan, and it was so great! We are in town for just a week and looking for stuff to do off the strip that's more Las Vegas local style and less expensive. This place was a great find!  The food came out so quick! Salsa chips and guacamole were included free. Got the special and it was so great and made so quickly but high quality.   Definitely recommend if you are in the area, looking for a quick, delicious and cheap bite

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tater tot special

5swhpIPjNDS0QDlWBT7erw.text: You know a place is pretty damn good when people are still talking about it two hours after you have had lunch!  Komex is just such a place.  After reading on yelp, I made the suggestion for lunch on a Friday.  We arrived just before the lunch rush and seating four people was not a problem.    After looking at the menu and knowing that I already love bulgogi, I went with two bulgogi tacos and shared a large portion of bulgogi fries.  Absolutely delicious!  Forks were parring each other to grab the next delicious bite.  When all was said and done all that was left was empty plates.  I was so geeked out on Komex, when I happened to be on that side of town, I took the Boy to enjoy the deliciousness this tiny, little Korean/Mexican fusion restaurant had to offer.  Who knew that one would have to wait for a lunch table on a Saturday!?  But we did even though waiting on a Saturday just plain SUCKS because I wanted the Boy to experience Korean marinated tastiness.  So we both ordered a fusion  burrito with bulgogi, mine also had fried kimchi.  We then did a half order of bulgogi ( I love that word) fries.  The ingredients are SUPER fresh, so fresh I felt myself getting a buzz with every bite. When dining on super affordable meal, don't forget to grab a hot sauce rack.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hWOku6g-30wTczjLH13dug.text: In Vegas for Memorial weekend and we decided to check Yelp for somewhere to eat lunch.  Decided on KoMex because it was nearby and because of its high reviews.  Great choice!  I didn't even realize it was Korean/Mexican fusion until I opened my menu.  The restaurant is small and was very busy.  Five of us were seated almost immediately, drink order taken shortly after and a basket of homemade chips, guacamole and salsa delivered shortly after.  I shared kimchee fried rice, fusion style flautas, tacos, and spam musubies.  The flautas were my favorite.  Everyone left full and happy.   Decided to come back two days later before heading home and decided on the Bulgogi tater tots.  I requested a fried egg on top and was happy I did.  It complimented my meal perfectly.  It was like breakfast all in one (tater tots, bulgogi, sour cream, cheese, and a fried egg by request) I highly recommend this restaurant.  Food is great, service is good and will definitely come back when in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi with tater tots and a request for a over medium egg on top.  Delicious!

sgJVizz9FMlSSjdBAZv0fw.text: I have been here many times and I have never been disappointed. It is a very small, basic place but the food is amazing! Today my boyfriend got the bulgogi rice bowl which had rice, cabbage slaw, kimchi, jalapenos, and beef bulgogi topped with a fried egg. It was a good sized portion and my boyfriend really enjoyed it. I had the bulgogi tater tots. The came out sizzling in a cast iron pan. The tots were topped with beef bulgogi, pork belly, and bacon. On top of that was tomatoes, green onions, and sour cream. It was delicious but next time I think I would add a fried egg. Every experience here has been wonderful, I highly recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi rice bowl.
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi tater tots.
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi nachos!!!!!

gOdHoXlfnroY-F8OnirXaw.text: Came here looking for some Korean/Mexican fusion and KoMex delivered. As the sign in their restaurant points out, KoMex is not fast food, but this little hole in the wall is very much casual. This place is all about the food and my favorite was the calamari taco! Crispy panko crusted on the outside and hot tenderness on the inside. A little lime and pico de gallo makes it perfect.   The bulgogi chimichanga was great as well but it had just a little too much cheese for me personally. I'll be back the next time I'm back in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari Taco
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi Chimichanga

cs8ywKnrE6dwpoOTgXIYrw.text: Just left this spot and honestly could not be happier with my quick dinner.  I had the veggie teriyaki with tofu, and my family had the Mexican fusion dishes.  Everything was cooked fresh, and presented perfectly, and ridiculously quick.  The yelp hype is real, go check this spot out. I wish I had a spot like this in my neighborhood

-0fGOoPKz2pJmkHIPIWjPA.text: He was craving tacos, I was craving rice. Enter KoMex. The surrounding area is a bit sketchy but I'll go anywhere for some good food. Based on the reviews, I was expecting a truly outstanding meal.   Bulgogi w/ white rice -- I will go as far and say the quality of the meat was top notch. Not a piece of fat in sight. However, the meat didn't have much flavor. Eating it with the white rice didn't help the cause either. They do sprinkle sesame seeds on top. It gives it a little color and some lively texture but that's about it. Not oily at all which is a plus.  Their tacos come loaded with your selected main ingredient and pico de gallo. You'd think two measly little tacos wouldn't fill you up but it surprisingly gets you pretty satisfied.   KoMex does the trick when you're craving for some Korean Mexican fusion food in Vegas. However, I might think twice the next time and hold off my cravings until I go to LA.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi w/ white rice
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi taco

lNto2UhMJL0FwETk5-gUmw.text: Honestly, the hype is real. This place is great. They start you off with chips and salsa (which in my books, is always a plus.) my father and I both ordered the bulgogi cheesesteaks with tater tots and they were heavenly. Lots of cheese and onions on top of bell peppers but they definitely do NOT cheap out on the meat. It is loaded with the bulgogi. Very good and cannot wait to come back and try some of their other menu items!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi cheesesteak and tater tots... 10/10 stars

D5pUTsSwEexk0_MKxghlcw.text: One of my go to spots for years now. If you like a bit of a twist on traditional Korean and Mexican food this is your place ! Customer service is always on point and  I haven't had anything  from here that wasn't top notch! I appreciate the time and dedication these folk put into their craft. Thank you Komex!

XZ586FLRjdNzIZ2oF4DJOw.text: I was surprised with the food, in a good way of coarse. I would highly recommend the Torta. It satisfied my cravings. Great costumer service as well!

FuM7pDWuUN4CAEakD3PUxw.text: Love this hole-in-the-wall just off the strip.  Can't complain about delicious and CHEAP food!!!  Big fan of the Fusion Tacos!!  I tried the Pork Belly and Beef Bulgogi ones. Kimchi Fried Rice with Spam was very tasty but a tad greasy for me. Chow Fettuccine was basically Chow Mein w/fettuccine... get it?  The only thing I wish I did get was the Fusion Nachos!!!!  Next time I'm back in Vegas, I will dine on this!!

cdfPjE0TcvBLW7CgEMcryQ.text: Killer food! Great service.  If you are in Vegas you need to stop by and try this place!

f2dph1KyL7tlhaTmgrOBoQ.text: Bulgogi Tater Tots  (Tater Tots topped with Beef Bulgogi, Pork Belly, Bacon Bits, Sour Cream, Tomatoes and Green Onions)  Pork belly bacon lettuce and tomato sandwich is the perfect side to the tater tots literally.  Great service, amazing food at very affordable prices. You get chips, salsa and guac for free. At the end of your meal, you get fortune cookies and sliced oranges speared with little plastic swords. It's Korean, it's Mexican...it's KoMex!!!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pebbly!

gqGdnuu-U6ZCk3Jufn70pA.text: Great food!!! Super cool fusions... Friendly staff and I need to try everything on these menus... I'm Korean and my girl is Mexican so it's hella cool. ;)

mq2Vozr68GS__A7iIyf_6A.text: KoMex...I had so many expectations for you and you know what you did?! You exceeded them. Congratulations.  Delicious and affordable food. Tried all the tacos and a half order of bulgogi fries, my favorites probably being the samgyupsal taco and the fries. They also give each table nachos with guac and salsa in the beginning (sweet!). We asked for more guac and they just gave us some! Free guac is the greatest thing in life, I swear.  Service was great and food was bomb. I can't wait until they open up their newest location near my house! I'll go there all the time.

2vjD0SEoUETM_9RxXSkhcw.text: If you like spicy hot get fusion menu. But if you like Korean go for the fried rice. Great fusion combinations. Will get toppings for fusion fries on the side.

PW_FyWeTxcg3lzsB2BdYOg.text: This is easily my favorite Mexican fusion joint. Let me tell you! The fusion flautas are to die for!!! They are like rolled up deep-fried tacos stuffed with bulgogi meat. I could eat this every day, except I have to watch my calories. But if I had one cheat day in a week, this would be my food of choice or at least in the top 5. Try it!!!

mn5Txaky_ygvzVk-kdlYFA.text: Where have I been during this KoMex kraze? Eating tacos and bulgogi elsewhere, I guess. It just didn't occur to me that I could've had both if only I visited KoMex, but better late than never, right?  The numerous close-up photos of Fusion Bulgogi Nachos alone are enough persuasion to visit. Unfortunately, my first visit was also my last.  I ordered the fish taco and Fusion Bulgogi Taco, and my friend ordered the Fusion Bulgogi Enchilada. We also requested a half order bowl of Fusion Bulgogi Nachos to share. Our waitress was kind enough to warn us that the full order might be too much, so we went with the half instead. She's right. The chips are enough to share with four people. Then again it all depends on everyone's hunger levels.  Our waitress started us off with a complimentary basket of hot homemade tortilla chips with side of guacamole and salsa. Very delicious and not greasy. They're thick and resemble pita chips. A fantastic start to our meal. So far so good.  We both were expecting our nachos to arrive first to tide us over as we waited for the arrival of our entrees -- we had both fasted for this visit and were really hungry! -- but that didn't happen. Instead, my friend's enchiladas arrived first followed by a short awkward period of waiting for my tacos and our order of nachos to come. Our entrees arrived warm instead hot, so that made us wonder if the food had been sitting out for a while before being delivered to our table.   My fish tacos weren't bad, but they're certainly not the best I've had. Here's what I like about their fish tacos:  - The fish isn't tiny and it's lightly fried. - It isn't slathered with thick specialty sauces.  The bulgogi tacos were tasty, and I enjoyed the sweet flavor of the bulgogi meat. I would've preferred a flour tortilla over the corn with this taco.   Fusion Bulgogi Nachos is a mountain a tortilla chips topped with mozzarella cheese, bulgogi, jalapenos, and a spicy sauce. Although delicious, when it arrived the cheese had cooled down and began to harden.   The meal was going well until I noticed my friend doing something unusual. At first I thought she was playing with a string of melted cheese that was hanging from one of the chips, but she was actually trying to move something. She pointed out a small black bug crawling on our table near our chips. We both thought it was a gnat but it didn't fly away. It couldn't had been a spider because it had  antennae and didn't crawl on eight legs. Rather than guessing what it was and where it came from, we stopped in the middle of our meals, paid the bill, and left with nauseating feelings in our bellies.  The cheap and decent eats would've brought me back for another try, but I don't think I can stomach the idea of returning.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fusion Bulgogi Nachos.
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish Taco and Fusion Taco.

2TBYEXavroA2z2_GG6CoGg.text: Back to get wreck, all respect to KoMex who break Their neck to keep their service in check 'Cause oh they combine Mexican and Korean majorly Free chips, salsa, and guacomole keeps amazing me She tell me there is bulgogi, on the torta or french fry But I order only a half order of bulgogi fries, I gotta take it easy Hate to sound sleazy, but I tease me, with a pork belly musubi And when I grub it, I got a problem saying bye bye Just another hazard of a fat guy   You ask why, don't matter, my pockets got fatter decent prices got you looking at the menu for the latter But Im a little greedy I have to order extra bulgogi cuz I like my fries meaty Food cooked to order so it won't be there in a jiffy My girl is picky, but she ate the chicken burrito in a quickie If you want fusion, you can't tie this place down But for strictly Korean, I look around

Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half eaten bulgogi torta

fvP8WVyGE59E6kizKkuYXg.text: Omg how have I not reviewed this slice of heaven yet?  This is the 1st eatery I recommend to people in Vegas now.   I don't live in Vegas. KoMex is now an absolute must go stop whenever I am in town. Twice within a 4 day visit is perfect.   The famous tostada is famous for good reason. For very good reason.   The guacamole is top 3 I've ever eaten, in any setting.   Do yourself a favor and order the hot kimchi   Go. Now. Take all your friends. If they are anything like my friends they will thank you mightily, then start going themselves, and send you photos, so you can jealously drool from hundreds of miles away.   The foodies are happy. The give me all the calories for very few dollars folks are happy.  The vegans are happy.  The spicy food lovers are happy.  The I can't handle spicy food folks are happy.  The food adventurous are happy.  The if I don't know that word I'm not eating it eaters are happy.   Fast service. Great joy. Too far from Colorado.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fusion tostada w chicken - $5 of such excellence!!! &#34;Popular with the ladies&#34; = ??? But so good and lovely service!

Ju7B1wkqjtJtMiP3ISDN-g.text: Interesting combo. It kind of tastes exactly how you would imagine ( the burritos and tacos). It wasn't like wow, these ingredients go really well together.  The loaded fries were good, I fail to remember when loaded fries are ever bad though. I think with so many good food options in Vegas, I wouldn't waste a meal here

uaztpzOcovR4Z-72z9Gujg.text: Super good food! Service was quick, the conversation from the owner was good and he made some recommendations that didn't disappoint. We had one beef and one pork taco, a beef tostada and a beef bowl -all to share. I'd get the tostada again and again, it was that delicious. I was too full to eat the tacos but y daughter ate them and said they were "smack" which in teenager terms apparently means "great, delicious, etc".   Good food, service and generous portions for a fair price.... what more can you ask for? Parking is tight as mentioned in other reviews, but that's not a deterrent for us.

kHOA-hfLCINQMEBpxqPIpg.text: Feel good about your life. You live in a time where you don't have to choose between having Mexican or Korean food for your meal. That's right, you can enjoy both...at the same time. What a world.  The bulgogi beef Asian fusion tacos or burritos are the most popular things to order here. But if you ask, the owners favorite is the spicy pork. I went with the spicy pork burrito. It's always best to take the chef's lead. I wasnt sorry. It was a flavor bomb packed with all sorts of goodness. I could recite the ingredients for you, but it would bore you to tears. Just know its delicious and you should eat it. Don't forget the selection of hot sauces. There are four to choose from and not a bad one in the bunch.  It's a small place with a real mom and pop feel. They still give you table service so you don't have to order at the counter like a savage. Parking is a little tight, but you'll manage.  They've had a fair amount of attention from press and television. You know why? It's good. Go check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy pork fusion burrito.  Delicious..and don&#39;t forget the hot sauces!
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big burritos!

io8ebmuFwjyZZaMbLjmuwA.text: I'm the type that once I find a dish I like at a place, I pretty much stick to it.  I don't like to think about what I want when I go to a place.  So I was reluctant to try something different.....This burrito blew me out of the water!   Not what I was expecting, these flavors just went well together.  The Mexican rice in it was amazing!  Now I have to think about what I want when I go back. I'm telling ya'll if your here in LV, if you try anything that I review, this is on the top of the list.....No. 1 on the list!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The burrito with spicy pork.

JJLr84_JMbpTied-7e0fNw.text: Located off Decatur Bl in Las Vegas. One of my buddies messaged me about this place and to check it out. Luckily I was with a friend today that was driving me around and knew where this place was. So we stopped by it's a small place and parking is tight too in the small plaza so it can get full at peak times when all the businesses are opened. The server was nice and helpful. I just got two shrimp tacos and they were good I'd recommend them. They also bring you complimentary chips and salsa. Prices were not bad either. Overall a good place i would come back again.

Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States

O3aETUo5UTW66FAb6fAujg.text: Very small place... cozy.... but the parking sucks... very limited and small... I saw this place on Diners Drive ins and Dives on the food network plus it was close by so  I called our order in i had to try a few times before i got through... man answered was nice but sounded was rushed... not knowing really what they have i asked him what was the best ordered... he said everything.... ok... that wasn't much help... so i just ordered the basic  fried rice, Korean chicken wings, fried wontons and bulgogi burger and fries...  Got there still had to wait but they make everything fresh so that was totally cool... but we were sitting on a small table just for two... then this group of 6 came in and there was a table that was set up already for a group that size right across the tiny room he made us move to sit somewhere else... whatever's... just when we moved to another spot our food was ready... yeah i thought it was a little rude... plus he didn't greet or acknowledge us when we entered and not a thank you when we left... We saw all the awards on the wall but having a great products you need great customer service... food was awesome but little disappointed about how we were treated...

vO12NyILdumc3iEINiJ-nA.text: If you drive by and don't see it, turn around---it's worth it! The flavors are amazing. The pork fusion taco was my favorite. Simply delicious! Beef bulgogi bowl was also very tasty! Their house chili sauce had just the right amount of spice. I will be coming back for sure!

Roh7z8prYshWTqIkrfZGUA.text: Food delicious, service amazing.  We heard about this place from a buzzfeed video from back in 2016 for best place to eat at while hung over. It did not disappoint. We were a group of 8 and sampled a ton of stuff on the menu. Everyone loved their food. I personally had the bulgogi flautas. From the sour cream, fresh salsa and guacamole with sriracha mixed in, it made the perfect bite of flour tortilla and traditional Korean marinated thin slices meat. Highly recommend getting off the strip and to this place for food.

74LaAdeoPidleT3SXM4L-Q.text: This place is so good. Been here a couple times now and they don't seem to ever disappoint! They start off with chips and salsa before the food comes. The salsa is really good!  Once the food comes out, you can't help but stare, it all looks so yummy! And all the meals are piled with food. My favorite is the fusion tater tots. They are so full of meat, cheese, sour cream, and sauces.  They also have a few different options of hot sauces to add to your meal, which I love. The service is always good and the food comes pretty fast. The prices are really reasonable too.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fusion Tots
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OrZqTIMogQ96UZjLvpVhJQ.text: It's been a bit so let's go!  3 simple criteria: Service, ambiance, and FOOD!!!  Service: Not gonna lie there wasn't much business in the timeframe that I went but it was fast and friendly and that's really all you need. The server that we had seemed to be running the front end by himself but he directed us where to sit and quickly gave us menus and asked for our drink order. He didn't miss a beat and we received all our food with not too long of a wait.  Ambiance: Nothing stood out in all honesty. You could definitely feel a mom and pop shop vibe and I don't know about you but I always like that. It wasn't flashy and it gave me a comfortable feeling. There seemed to be original art on the walls with cute characters.  Food: Alright so here's the best part as always. So I went with some family members and we ordered Spam musubi, spam fried rice, bulgogi rice bowl, mini quesadillas, and bulgogi nachos. Spam musubi and the mini quesadillas were for my nephew. He is a picky eater but he ate every bite didn't complain or ask for something different. That's already a win for me. The spam fried rice was seasoned well no complaints there. Bulgogi rice bowl came with other than the obvious... Coleslaw, baby greens, kimchi, jalapenos, and a sunny side egg. Be aware the photo looks smaller than the portion. It was way more than I could eat. The bulgogi nachos took me away though. I loved the flavors! I was always able to get a bit of everything in each bite. I loved the food and the prices are not bad at all for the amount they give you.  My only thing would be that they put cilantro in the bulgogi rice bowl and the bulgogi nachos. I'm not of fan of cilantro at all if I'm being entirely honest. The nachos I didn't mind but I did taste it in the rice bowl. I definitely should have asked and will do so next time just a bit unexpected in the bowl. Will definitely come again!!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YQP4jkByyN23d4OVDzHmxQ.text: I miss their location on the West side but this place although small is worth the wait unless you get there at the right time. The spicy pork dishes are my favorites. Today I had the tostada with a crispy rice cake with loads of flavor pork, slaw and korean sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy pork fusion tostada

YoM5kBtiWCL7H4TQhNDseQ.text: A couple of locals directed us to this place for lunch.  It may be counterintuitive to combine Mexican and Korean flavors BUT IT WORKS!  I tried all of the fusion seafood tacos and my buddies had the cheesesteak, fusion burrito and quesadilla.  All highly recommended.  Service was fantastic.  Keep in mind, the food is all made to order, so it is not fast food.  It's well worth the wait (10 mins or so).  I'm definitely bringing my family back to KoMex!

wmIpDnOwzvuVdf7D0Ox7sg.text: I be been coming here for a few years. Not sure why I haven't written a review yet.  I have never been disappointed from the fusion tacos to the incredible Chow fun combo.  Everything is distinctly flavorful.  My most recent experience was the Kalbi burger.  This is a must try burger.

tuK1PYtTH7JBMQSWVFmg7w.text: One of the best fusion choices forever and for all time. My cousin was in town and saw this place so we headed there to try it. I pass it all the time and keep meaning to stop in, I just always forget! I'm so mad at myself because I could have been eating their delicious food months ago.  Service was great, despite only one man working up front. We got our food promptly and drinks never got empty. The pricing of the food was amazing, cheap and huge portions!   Now the food. OMG! It's pretty hole in the wall, but the food is amazing. I had a beef bulgogi burrito and every element of it was amazing, as are their hot sauces too! My cousin got the bulgogi grilled cheese and she loved it. The menu has me wanting to try everything, so I'll definitely be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My happy face over this food!
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef bulgogi burrito!

GAlLgDPL2pWEsxu881DFXQ.text: You won't find anything else like this place. It's True family owned Korean Mexican fusion. And cheap cheap cheap! I recommend starting with tacos if your a newbie and the working towards the other stuff. The Korean meat is on point! The loaded fries are my favorite combining cheesy and that sweet and spicy Korean sauce... so good! There's always police in here eating and you know they know where all the good restaurants are. Takes about 15 minutes to get your food. Two huge thumbs up one of the best places in Vegas!

mFNvwiL8AAF9JB-Yh9z3SQ.text: This place is pretty good, I tried the Bulgogi beef burrito, and bulgogi pork nachos. All the meat is marinated as bulgogi, you just have to choose which type of meat. The burrito was pretty good, although there was more lettuce than I prefer. I actually prefer beans and rice and salsa.. but overall it had a good taste and not overly salty which I was concerned it may be, but it was just right. The nachos were good and I really liked the pork bulgogi. It added a hint of sweet to the saltiness and paired well as a fusion Korean/Mexican dish. I came on a Saturday at 7:45p not realizing  they close at 8p so keep that in mind! But they were still helpful and accommodating!

h6w4766AApC2L2ohG-JKWw.text: We came here today for lunch. It is a hole in the wall place serving fresh made to order Korean - Mexican and American food. You get complimentary homemade fresh nachos with salsa and guac with the meal. Cook to order so there's a little bit of a wait.  Our favorite are   ~Fusion Tater Tots $9  Beef Bulgogi, Bacon and Pork Belly + Mixed Cheeses, Topped with Sour Cream, Tomatoes n Green Onions.  And  ~Fusion Grilled Cheese Sandwich $6  They were both tasty and filling.Their home made salsas and sauce were fantastic.   We also tried their Fusion Wings and Pan Fried Fish which were ok. Anything with Bulgogi rocks!! and that's what I'll be ordering next time I come here.  The waitress was friendly and attentive. It's a great place to eat and doesn't break the bank.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States

F4N7Fe1n9hq3eT545gKQQg.text: I had to check out KoMex Fusion restaurant that was featured on BuzzFeed. Check out the Youtube video (youtu.be/tCqu3dxm56g). I literally had to try everything they ate on the featured video. I have to agree, GREAT HANGOVER FOOD! Decently size portion and prices for what you get! I tried the following: + 1/2NACHO- 1/2FRY COMBO with Chicken with Mozzarella Cheese, Pico de Gallo, Jalapeno & Korean Hot Sauce = was nice to start of with something crunchy and spicy. A great appetizer to share with your friends. I would get this again. + Bulgogi Tater Tots = Tater tots with cheese, bulgogi, sour cream, pork belly, bacon, and tomato. It is golden, perfect, and just the perfect amount of crunch. + Fusion Chimichanga with Beef = with Mexican Rice and Cheese inside. That is topped with Enchilada Sauce, Cheese, KoMex Slaw and Pico de Gallo. IS TO DIE FOR! I could eat this over and over again! + KimChi Fried Rice with Spam with Sunnyside up Egg on top = I love the kick of spice. but it's not too spicy. You cannot go wrong with this.

z38oTr1MP1w-inyfJ4qKug.text: This place is fantastic. While you may find the facade misleading, for it appears to be a typical fast food joint, you would be wrong. The food is made fresh to order, and depending on the crowd, may take a bit of time. It is always bursting with unique flavor. And simply delicious! I am quite partial to the bulgogi flautas, but I enjoy their tacos as well. The menu offers plenty of variety. Definitely check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States
