Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free chips and salsa
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tater tots!

1xAB_VzNNU5m5Qj-wCNCng.text: What a difference a year can make. I honestly created a Yelp account to rave about this place. It used to be amazing. However, the second location opened pretty recently, and it was a extremely disappointing the last time I had it.  Being a frequent customer for the past year or so, I did not hesitate to buy $40 worth of food for the family. I always tell my friends about this place. Unfortunately, something happened here recently (maybe a new chef), and the quality decreased significantly. Here's the meal we had:  Fusion Burrito: Soggy. Extremely soggy. It tasted like somebody drenched the greens inside with water and removed any semblance of rice and meat. I could barely eat half of it. This used to be a favorite of mine!  Fusion Quesadilla (with spicy pork): Also disgusting! I don't know how you mess up spicy pork and cheese. I got this for my little niece, and she barely had two bites. I thought something was wrong with her, so I tried it too. Straight to the trash... How can a quesadilla have a weird aftertaste?  Shrimp Taco: The shrimp was definitely old. The aged seafood smell spread strongly throughout the house.  We had a few more things, and they were adequate I guess. The aforementioned items were the worst.  I'm so, so disappointed. I'm tempted to leave one star, but I put two out of respect for what the restaurant once was. Maybe I caught them on a bad day, but what I received was inexcusable.

kOXANmWBo2cJEUGMgJ-W8g.text: Great food. Very customer friendly. Nice and clean. I will be back for sure. I love the bulgogi fries. Might try a burrito next time. Kinda small tho inside so if it's busy it can be a little annoying. The prices are great too. The $2 tacos are a great bargin. They could charge more for them. This place has a lot of high reviews for a reason lol. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fusion fish taco
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi fries

yeA_DClYmDBkybrIIWwksg.text: I'm always on the look out to eat off the Strip whenever I'm in Vegas, and this place popped up during my search. Korean-Mexican fusion food is nothing new to me, having eaten from the Kogi truck many times (as well as other imitators) in the LA/OC area. But I was curious about this place and its menu, so I had to check it out.  The is definitely a hole-in-the-wall, nestled in a cozy strip mall. We were greeted warmly, sat down, and wasted no time ordering. We were served complimentary chips with guacamole and salsa -- all of which were completely addicting before the food even arrived. We tried the following:  Fusion tacos, bulgogi and chicken: bright, fresh, and healthy. This was definitely my favorite. I loved the crispy texture from the slaw, and the meat was moist and tender. The kimchi on top gave that bit of tang to tie the "fusion" of it all together.  Bulgogi burrito: monstrous, filling, and utterly satisfying. I split this in half with my wife, and it was more than enough. The ratio of rice to meat was good, and the flavors were fantastic. A bit of hot sauce rounds it all up, flavor-wise.  Bulgogi fries, half order: this was my least favorite. The skinny fries were a bit on the soggy and greasy side, and the cheese was already hardened and coagulated by the time it got to our table. The sparse toppings of bulgogi was a bit disappointing as well. We picked at it, but we were already more than full with the burrito and tacos.  Service was superb. Our waters were always topped off, the waitresses always asked how we were doing, and smiled a lot. It was a great vibe in there. You could tell everyone in there was enjoying their food. It felt like I was a guest at a family or friends' home. We were even served chilled orange slices before the usual fortune cookies.  Overall, I'm a fan of the place. With the fusion tacos and burritos, the ingredients are fresh and not overly heavy. Kogi packs a huge punch with more intense flavors and spices, and can get a bit greasy. KoMex is sort of the more healthier and "lighter" version of Kogi, in my opinion. The food is nothing unique, but the ultra friendly prices and service pushes them to 5 stars in my book.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi fries - half order
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fusion burrito - bulgogi
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fusion tacos - bulgogi and chicken

9s58sa67dsw9lLjXrYjN-A.text: So I've been going on a bulgogi binge of late. This place is on the way home from work and I decided I had t see what all the yelping was about. It's in a small complex that has a couple of empty/broken into/deserted stores that really make you believe you took a wrong turn and may be entering the slums of Bombay. Either way, don't drive by too fast, otherwise you'll miss this camouflaged beauty..  The first time I came in, they said there would be a 30 minute wait for a to go order. I decided against the wait and made a plan of coming back the next day, but making sure to order ahead. I would recommend doing the same because I think 20-30 minutes is the norm for a to go order at any time of the day.  I ordered a Bulgogi and Kimchee burrito. Usually the only burritos I ever get are from Chipotle, but how can you pass up Korean Mexican? We don't have any of these places in Arizona so the novelty was not lost on me. The burrito was overfilled with bulgogi (the way i like it) and was super spicy (also the way i like it). Bottom line: It was super bueno. Make sure you have an ice cold drink to tolerate this burrito. And this place is light on your wallet, $5.50 or so was the total...but make sure you bring cash if your total is under $10.

uq_YswbJ36zjgcRk-n3j6w.text: First time here we wanted burritos ... Was missing the white rabbit ! This place is awesome tons of fusion choices .. Salsas to go with the burritos .. Nachos with bubgogi was awesome ... Wonton soup was so good had an half order .. Should have gotten a full .. Everything is made to order so expect a small wait . The only complaint .. Is that all the sodas are cans or bottles so no free refills u have to pay for each can or bottle also it was pretty warm my baby was sweating inside

Nw82PZ30J7arJBTx6PR6jw.text: I had the chicken bulgogi and it was very good.  The flavors were all new to me and very enjoyable.  The service was a little slow, but we did have a larger group and we were not in a hurry.  The prices were pretty cheap for the amount of food I got.  Everyone in our group enjoyed their meal.  I would definitely go back if I am in that area.  If you are looking for a very filling lunch you've come to the right place.

GJvSj42KFofl8XSjRF8J8Q.text: Hidden Jem in LV. I love these hole in the wall places. I highly recommend the spicy pork tacos.

-Apf0-wAJMkjBSuHsaJoXA.text: I wasn't looking for any mexican food on this vegas trip. I'm from los angeles; mexican food is everywhere, but with the korean/mexican fusion, I was really interested in coming here. Well, I loved it!! Wish there was one in LA!  Came and ordered the bulgogi tots. My boyfriend got the bulgogi nachos/fries combo and we shared some pork belly musubi.  Delicious delicious delicious! My boyfriend and I agreed that the bulgogi tater tots stole the show. Cheesy, crunchy and super tasty!! With green onions and sour cream. Yummy! I love musubi, but never tried pork belly musubi before; it was damn good and they make them pretty big too.  Complimentary chips, salsa and guac. Guacamole was also delicious. Good stuff!

aAvxKvx90-xCMMAizCFSDw.text: We found Komex on Yelp about 5 years ago, and it has become one of our all-time favorite restaurants. It's a simple hole-in-the-wall type restaurant, low price, large portions, unique dishes, and amazing flavors. We've tried about everything on the menu, and it's all crazy good. Some of the best tacos I've ever had, some of the best fried rice I've ever had, the best salsa and guacamole I've ever had.  Even the sliders...why do they have sliders at a Korean Mexican restaurant?? I don't know, but thank heaven they did because those sliders are AMAZING! Go to Komex!! Order anything and slap some Komex sauce on it. You'll crave it til you can go back...

xMPpsRb7EeCNjM9sFKN8Ow.text: I don't like to write reviews for places that have a lot of reviews already. But this place is deeeeeelicious and I would like to share my thoughts.   My friends have been telling me about it for awhile, and I had heard about it but I was kind of nervous with the whole Asian/Mexican fusion. It didn't sound too appealing to me. This is a dive, but as I always say, I have found some of the most amazing food in the most unexpected places.   I remembered it the other day when we were running errands and my boyfriend didn't sound too excited either after I told him what it was. I assured him that I trusted my friend's opinion and that it had really good reviews on Yelp.   We had the following - (Mind you, this was only two of us.) Fushion Shrimp Taco  Fushion Daeji gogi Taco 2 chicken flautas Fusion Enchilada Plate with shrimp, Bulgogi (Beef), Dak-gogi (Chicken). They serve chips, salsa and guacamole. All very good. The salsa is awesome.  Oh, as always...a Mexican coke. This was all $17.00.  All very amazing. We both LOVED everything. Even the sauces they give you for the food were delicious!  I went back the NEXT DAY and got the Chow Fettuccine(Thick Noodles with Meat* and Vegetables) with beef.   ***Warning, they do use a lot of garlic, so expect to be tasting it for awhile after you eat.   I love this place, and it is one of my new favorites. The prices are AWESOME, service is friendly and very quick. Don't let the idea scare you, it's much better than you can imagine.

HO_L9_5KzmcgwyOleUL_lQ.text: Stopped by, and this place was amazing. The portions were HUGE for a very reasonable price. Everything was solid. The Bulgogi tater tots are a must-try!

AulYpWTzbYBEOPze2KgZww.text: Great food at a resonable price. So good you don't even mind the older small dining area. The have plans to update the dining area soon. The best items are the fusion menu items: enchiladas, nachos, and toastadas. The best meat is the pork by far. If you eat pork skip the others meats if you don't try the beef. Great value for flavors and porition sizes.

9H_oqxnaf2lyTxl01UhHug.text: Tofu now available, so now you can officially have it all at KoMex, and it is as drool-inducing as ever. The specials board is also worth a gander. Most recently it featured what is easiest described as a bibimbap taco salad. Delicious veggies, tender marinated meat, and a perfectly kick in the tastebuds sauce served over rice in a giant tostada, seriously more delicious than your average Korean BBB. I think  the secret is the healthy helping of fresh greens. It does appear that they aren't offering noodle dishes these days. No big deal. If you haven't made it to KoMex, the time is long overdue!

hopuI3zJE_gVzdlHzTZEIw.text: Felt like I was back in Pyeongtaek, Korea!! Had the bulgogi plate (the 1/2 was more than enough) and it was delicious. Nice price and nice service

mNLYxNU1O9kWg82Z3ISRhg.text: Read the other reviews, believe what you read here and just go, you will not regret it. Very friendly, good food and inexpensive. We need to support these kinds of great businesses that are such value and will be missed if they don't stick around. Go, eat, enjoy, come back again ya hear!

SNrD3A15qk5J7lpRk_o9_Q.text: The best restaurant in Las Vegas. The sweetest owner, phenomenal food & wonderful prices! Only downside is that it's become so popular that they get Very busy & it's not a big restaurant. But it's worth the time and effort!!

O4iToNBIrra9TqMlz3Ke7A.text: I had the flu when i hate their nachos and they were still SO good. All my meat eating friends wouldn't stop talking about how good the food was and how awesome the meat was. When i placed my order the girl on the phone was a bit rude when i asked them to put the meat on the side of my nachos("we don't do that here") But they did and I'll totally be returning. Awesome food with a great concept!

LviB8Dt6sUj8-dqv6PM0NA.text: Excellent tasty unique tacos at a low price - couldn't ask for more. Gets very busy at lunch - prepare to wait, or try not to go during the 11:30-1:30 window.

uPjfQE088w7ZFxJFg808vw.text: Korean Mexican fusion! Whats not to love? The Bulgogi fries and the quesadilla is what I tried and they were fantastic. I also had a bite of one of the tacos and for the price they can not be beat. Fantastic place and great service.

vW2GeHAYp3a3PTrCg6hrpw.text: Good food, good service = great atmosphere. Bulogi fries, spam musubi, taquitos, fusion tacos, mexican soda! yeah! Must try fried rice next time for sure! This is a 5/5 to go place whenever I'm in Vegas for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My beef Bulgogi Fusion burrito was pretty good
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spam and egg musubi was to die for!
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing mexican sodas. $2 a pop

yLvjGUaFjdckmCGeAH_8ew.text: Great concept! You have to love  korean food in order to enjoy the fusion of both. My Latin friends didn't  enjoy  it as much as I did. I'm filipino and enjoy all Asian foods. Living  in San Diego I got a lot of Mexican food being so close to the border. I love this place! The other reviews are all on point. I'm gonna make this my new fav. When I'm in town. Fast, friendly service. What more can you ask for right!

o7VOqt_JY6H6oSdE4oM1cg.text: Y'all are crazy.  I don't know how this place has so many stars.  I was not impressed.  Maybe I just had different expectations of what the food would taste like.  Korean and Mexican...I'd expect some spice.  Everything tasted sweet to me.  I don't think I'd try it again.

OMXXfxoPJwDaYn4GjZcVZw.text: Excellent food. Had the bulgogi chicken & beef combo and the teriyaki chicken both were on point. The rice could have been better but not a deal breaker. Only 3 stars because the older Asian man that assisted my wife was rude. Everybody has their bad days, hope his gets better.

PeEtY-qsI8iOfE4J5E-WWw.text: I ate here a while ago and it was the first thing my friend and I ate after a day in Red Rock and as soon as it hit our stomachs we knew we were in for some horrible food poisoning. I kid you not, I went to the bathroom to throw up in the middle of the meal because my stomach hurt so bad. I have never gone back and as much as I love the idea and concept of this place, I do not want to have to worry about shitting my pants everytime I eat a bulgogi burrito.

1xMR5b0z1OulGAFWer3dLg.text: i ate here about a year or two ago.  it is the only meal in vegas i remember, thats how good it was.  i love komex and will be back ASAP next time i'm in Vegas!

yCOjED0SvlkWzxN98VrGhQ.text: I am from So Cal and live in an area where there are a lot of wonderful Mexican Restaurants but I have never had anything like this. I was in Vegas this past weekend and went out of my way for the second time to enjoy a wonderful meal at KoMex Express. The food is great and the prices are very reasonable. To quote a former California governor "I'll be back".

GfiHfVw-SNtqw6GhnwDn-Q.text: Say MexKo When I was a kid I saw this commercial where someone carrying a piece of chocolate fell into someone holding peanut butter, and peanut butter cups were discovered! Now, that's fusion! I don't know who fell into who here but mixing  Korean and Mexican did not have the same effect as the peanut butter cups for me. And don't get me wrong the food wasn't bad but I would rather have either Korean or Mexican, but not mixed, which they also serve. I did like the chips the salsa and the guacamole they were very tasty, and I would stop here just for that. Service was very good, very friendly and attentive. The place is small but kept clean. Oh! And the Korean lady taking my order and asking me how I wanted the food made, in Spanish! Now that's a bonus star! (Review went from three to four.)  I will probably stop again  and try other items, Mexican or Korean but not mixed. For now, I'll just stick to my own Korean, Mexican fusion..... me and my Hyundai.

FTDXuUNe7doBdQFXT2VBBQ.text: Super good Food I would go here again the best place in Vegas. Good place to eat while you are getting your phone fixed next door

VwXT9gJEb3ns-zX-gpF9yA.text: The food here is pretty decent with the fusion but it is super greasy. It would be perfect if you're hungover. Also just a note the portions are MASSIVE and you definitely get your money's worth.

oTrqM04JRHiFdMFMIFOmjQ.text: Best Mexican in Vegas. Very good quality of food for fraction of the cost.

7nvQg2Cmvsdp8HTlffTt6A.text: Yummy food! Great service! Cheap prices! one star off for ambience, but you can go wearing t-shirt and flip flops

P2BFW2BS8MlEFSqP80af2Q.text: Wow! Just got back from Ko Mex. Wife & I spent a whopping $19.55 for 3 fusion tacos, 2 tacquitos & kimchee fried rice!  Ko mex is just as most reviewers see it, a small shop in a strip mall that I would have easily passed had it not been for Yelp.  We drove the 10 miles from our hotel to try Ko Mex. All I can say is I wish we had one of these in Torrance. The Fusion tacos, both beef & chicken with kim chee were absolutely DEEEE LISH ISSS! But my fave was the lettuce wrap with pork! I let my wife taste it ( she had the kim chee rice ) & she wolfed 3/4 of the wrap while I was sucking down a Pina Jarrito!   Great service, we were so lucky it wasnt too busy so service was extra qwik. I love hitting these places during non peak days as you feel unrushed and can really enjoy the food....Oh btw, we had to bring half the rice home cuz we were so full! Add in orange & fortune cookies for dessert & you have one Fantastic place to Eat. So happy we found this treasure!

z3oYloXhE9J_CkpyZ0CeWA.text: Wow. The food here is amazing! So far I have tried the Bulgolgi Burrito, flautas, chimichanga and Tacos. They are all delicious, but I'd have to say the simple burrito and taco are my favorite. A basic burrito with Bulgolgi...sounds so simple but it works deliciously well together. The man who is always in the front is a little grumpy. He never smiles and seems to be in a bad mood every time. The other people are really nice though. Regardless. I absolutely love the food and will be coming back many many times!

ixpFb7Zn7lDsfOuaUQw8PQ.text: Great place for a quick lunch. Parking was tight. I ate here with my family several months ago and we enjoyed the bulgogi burrito and bulgogi fries. I stopped here during a work lunch break and tried the bulgogi fried rice. I ordered a half order and it was surprisingly big. The dish was tasty. They gave chips and salsa and guacamole while I waited for my food.

ENb5bmxKvP8Bexl6NZQFVQ.text: Great food and service! A small, simple place in an unassuming spot. Which is great for keeping prices low, but not for people driving across town and hoping to dine in. But, the food is so good, I'll eat it in my truck if I have to. Good size portions yet inexpensive enough were you can try multiple menu items in one visit. Definitely recommend.

VyCif-hRmUvGCVkEmc1vXQ.text: A dive, and it's good!   Seating is very limited - so you may have to wait for a table before you can eat. They do have some chairs you can sit and wait for a table.  They do have 1 large table for a group - which is also screened off for privacy. The other side most seating is half chairs and booth style. The cushions on the booth could use a do over as the foam padding is kinda worn out. That and when I tried to place a package on one of the cushions - it wouldn't stay put, started to slide off the cushion. That's the only reason I suggest re-doing the padding. The cushion fabric is in great shape!  Food wise - Can't really complain! Very tasty! For the tot we ordered Bulgogi fried rice - very mild but good. For my taste buds - would have preferred a little more moisture (i.e. sauce or something), but hubby and child were happy with it as presented. Hubby ordered the Torta, and spicy pork taco. I had two spicy pork tacos. The tacos were surprisingly small - but LOADED to the brim, and overflowing with goody morsels. And surprisingly they were very filling - so I understand the small size. Hubby was extremely happy with the spicy pork as well, and he was overloading with his torta. The only part he wasn't fond of in the torta was the pickled jalapenos. He was kinda under the impression the jalapenos were diced up raw ones, not the pickled ones - so he was slightly disappointed about that. But he picked them out no probs.  We'll be back another day! Have to try the lettuce wrap tacos, and many others! :D

seTO0gk0rn6xMoRJp7lKnw.text: I had the bulgolgi taco and fries for ~11.   - Taco was savory! i enjoyed the kimchi substitute.  - Fries are creative yet too sweet. I prefer the regular carne asada fries.  - Pricing is very reasonable. - Great service. I was delighted to find out that the bottle of water was free of charge!  ^____^!

aJ_ZmH8PkjD6OsEXBGoKOw.text: I had fusion tacos,wonton soup,combo fried rice and fusion torta it was ok not to be a regular thing but a once In a while its ok

oR2M0AtTpvZeyfyoSPDHTA.text: My first UYE event and it so happens to involve an eating contest! Okay, bring it on!   The service is friendly and fast. Lots of smiles on hardworking people can only mean that love is being poured into these delicious bites.  That's right I said it! Delicious bites!   My favorite of course are the bulgogi beef tacos with a healthy cabbage slaw topping on some delicate corn tortillas! The grilled pork and chicken tacos were very tasty as well. Also, a large selection for bevrages  occupy a commerical slider fridge to the left of the restaurant so fear not if you take on too much salsa!  I am proud to say that I ate 5 whole tacos but not anywhere close to the amount of tacos Eric, Jen, Danny and Gabe ate.  I met some really cool people and I made out with a cool Komex T-shirt for being the only female who attempted this beast of a challenge. On a side note I'd reccommend checking out these fun Yelp events in the future.  I do recommend eating early at Komex because there is a nice crowd for dinner that pulls through and seating can fill up quickly.  Who'd of thought Korean and Mexican cuisine could match up perfectly? I guess Komex did!

Vu6alZoGQC05bik7e19NUA.text: Delicious food, just amazing flavor!! Completely worth the short drive from downtown. This place is perfect for vegetarians. So many fun menu items to choose from. Also, great service as well. Highly recommended!

jZWRKQGzdIwwww9RlGDhIQ.text: This review is for my 2nd visit to KoMex. We showed up on a nice drizzly day ready for some fusion! We enter, there is only 1 other table occupied and we're offered high chairs right away and sit down. Hubby and I order their passion iced tea which is DELISH! We decide on the combo fried rice and I get the fusion torta. The rice had a perfect texture and was FULL of bulgogi, pork, and chicken. There was also the other fried rice staples egg, carrot, and peas. We ate almost all of it between the 3 of us but couldn't finish it lol. The fusion torta was AWESOME it comes with bulgogi, lettuce, jalapenos, tomatoes, avocado, onions, and mayo. They put a red sauce on it that I'm not sure what it was but still awesome and wasn't spicy! This thing is HUGE it has to be about 8-9 inches long and full of bulgogi. I super appreciate they don't skimp here. It would be so easy since it's a family run, small business to take away some protein!    I would never think a korean, mexican, chinese fusion place would be so kid friendly but it really is! There were 3 tables with kids at one point while we were eating. For being number 3 on Vegas' top rated on yelp they live up to it by far. The only downside is not having fountain drinks! I give them 4.5 stars!!!!

6P55UTZl0uEa5qXtFmwN1w.text: My favorite comfort food along the 95 corridor.  Bulgogi street tacos with kimchi and salsa?  Yes, please!

Y6bF3kMrThXHFA_UX2GY3g.text: The food was great and service was genuine.   The spicy pork fusion chimichanga was great!

XjMRszQOo3cZuBnIWXc4zA.text: I LOVE this place! I've been here a few times on a whim and each time has been great. So far I've had: Spam Masubi, Teriyaki Chicken, fusion tacos, fusion burrito, and fish tacos, but there is still SO much more I want/need to try! The Spam Musubi was huge (probably why they call it "Flintstone" musubi) and you get two big ones for 3 bucks. The Spam was nice and crispy, but the rest of the musubi seemed to fall apart very easily (s3-media4.ak.yelpcdn.com...); Not a big problem though because I love Spam and rice anyway. The tacos are exploding with flavor and you can't beat the price ($1.29 a pop, really!!?). I've had the pork, chicken, beef, and fish taco. The fish tacos were a little too salty for me, but the rest were amazing. The burrito was also very large, but that didn't effect the quality. It was very flavorful, juicy, and oozing with deliciousness. I ate about half and brought the rest home to my brother who nearly killed it in one bite. I can't wait to come back here. Every time we've gone, the service has been very fast and friendly. They even give you complimentary chips, dip, guac, and oranges (after the meal). I wish it wasn't so far from my house, but at least my boyfriend lives down the street from it, so I can get KoMex to-go ;)

2z75vXlX_naEUbZJjXUQOA.text: My family and i decided to try this place based on the rave reviews here on yelp. We fed a family of 4 for less than $40. That's the only real plus is the price. They do give you a lot of food too. The taste however was nothing to write home about.  I had the spicy pork and beef bulgogi with rice. Although it was sorta good it tasted sorta dry. My wife had their beef fusion burrito and said it was the best she ever had.   This is a good family place because a lot of adults brought their kids there and they were just running around. For the first time ever I told my kids if they want to play around at a restaurant they can. If you're the type of person that likes nice quiet romantic settings don't go here. It's a family (with kids) restaurant.  3 things that bother me: (1) when you walk in, even though you can sit immediately at a table because it's a really small place, they have a stupid sign asking you to wait to be seated. I'm sorry but the atmosphere of this place doesn't scream high class si why are you pretending to be high class by making us wait???  (2) They don't have fountain drinks. You have to order canned or bottled drinks and they charge a lot for them. Whatever savings you have from the food will be made up for with the cost of drinks. And it's not like you can get a free refill on drinks when they are canned/bottled  (3) The best and most surprising thing about this place is that they make their own homemade nachos and they taste great. You'll instantly want more but they only brought 1 little small basket for all 4 of us to share. The basket is so small you'd think they should bring 1 for each person or at least give us a much bigger bowl of chips (enough to feed 4)  With all that being said I would recommend someone to try this place but if you have to drive more than 10 mins to get to it then it's not really worth it. We drove all the way from Henderson so it was like a 20-30 minute drive and I didn't think it was worth that.

Sjoh-O30SjUh1W88rhW4FQ.text: This place has the kimchi fusion burritos I literally dream about. Once you have them, all other burritos will feel incomplete!!  This is one of my top places in Vegas. It's a little hidden gem of a place where you can get food unlike anywhere else that will tantalize your taste buds and not break your wallet.

cEyfsP1veANipLxBcshoWQ.text: The food choices are good here. Service is always friendly. The servers know and always welcome return guests. Affordable and portions are according to prices. Will be back as usual.

0plpGvcnmnJfNLoVcw49vQ.text: I had the 2 item plate and it was so good. Their bolgi beef was delicious. Very tender and the rice was good too. Great service will be coming back soon

N59CQxyEzudmCrP9Ob8JTw.text: Kind of a throw back joint.  Food was pretty good.  Some of the things that go to me were a few soggy tortilla chips and the beef taste over marinated,a little to salty.  But over all the service was great.  Again, it is what it, simply great.  So when you approach the door of this local "hole in the wall" joint leave your pretenious thoughts ouside and prepair yourself for great food truck style food, in a sit down restaurant. Mmmm, mm...

xh7kCom4uG95_zO5fsDKwA.text: This place is soooo good.  And love the prices, it's a small place but they're remodeling!  Offers American and Mexican sodas ::thumbs up::

uQ_Qh6CTuEEyq8pia2t4DA.text: KOMEX! WOW! nuff said. 1. Cheap!  2. Huge portions.   C. Friendly staff IV. Delicious.  Definitely lived up to the reviews on Yelp!  Go with the fusion offerings before anything else on your first visit.  The Bulgogi (beef) taco's are cheap and amazing.  I down like 3 of these on each visit. Free chips, Salsa, and Guac. start the meal. We usually do one dish with the tacos.  The kimchi fried rice is delicious and HUGE, with a fried egg on top. Especially after 2-3 taco's you'll definitely have leftovers. The Mongolian beef is also worth a try.  Decor needs updating as it looks old and a bit run-down on the inside..but i guess with the type of reviews they've been getting and since the food speaks for itself, I'm sure the owners could care less.  The only way to describe this place is truly with the corny albeit often used phrases:  **HIDDEN GEM** **MUST TRY** **FOODGASM** **GO-TO SPOT**  But i wouldn't write those words if they weren't True about Komex.

JzeryMFSxN0v5QjxALqezg.text: Food was amazing. Had a pork belly taco and a bulgogi taco, that woulda been filling enough. Then split the bulgogi tots those were great too, decent portion size. Definitely full after leaving woulda been fine with just the two tacos.   Definitely want to come back and try other menu items  Only thing I regret is I forgot to request kimchi (only a fault of my own )    Will most definitely be coming back.,

asVJ5jN9tx3rqRWlerYGgg.text: Poor costumer service. Arrived 15 min before closing at 8:00pm .  They asked if dining in or to go . They were ready to go home. Not willing to make a sale .. First time here and first impression very disappointed. An awesome way to blow off costumers!!!

SCjXj8VwyASzFUgcK6BF8g.text: This place reminded me of Yama Sushi for being crowded and limited on privacy spacing. It got so bad to one point my father was engaging in other customers conversation! Luckily, they didnt mind though. Lol  Fusion Bulgogi Nachos(7) were real tasty, just didnt like how the nachos were made at all. They were to hard to bite which made it less enjoyable. Lets say more of a vigorous crunch than a nice crisp. The Spicy Pork Plate(9) was deliciously moist, sweet and tender with the perfect bite to it! Comes with a whole pot of rice too (not literally).  Comfort wise, it was just their bathroom that needs some work.  Some needs here and there but wont stop me from coming back to try more of their different entrees.

dy7Iia1213BlJV5ktGu2fw.text: Amazing!! Definitely a place to come back to! Friendly staff and amazingly delicious food! Highly recommend the Bulgogi tater tots and the fusion flautas!!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y0bC5ElT813M7l0tX4g7Nw.text: The food is sooooo good you taste the freshness and the customer service is great spicy chicken is delicious add mixed vegetables for only $1

5CCovf7zF0wKY1qi37q_1w.text: Korean fusion with Mexican. What the! But wow, it's pulled off nicely. My wife and I split the meals and had a lot left over, big portions at good prices. The service was pleasant and attentive, the restaurant is small, basic, but clean. But onto the food:  The chips were delish! Not your basic thin chips. And they include guacamole at no cost.  There are three menus, Korean, Mexican, and Fusion. Fusion flautas with bulgogi meat. Heavenly. Three large flautas and seasoned guacamole & sour cream side.  Fusion Burrito. Good, not knock your socks off, but good. I'll just eat more flautas.  Bulgogi fries.....Yummy! More like nachos but with fries and Komex goodness.  All this, and a coke for $25. We'll be back. Oh yes, we'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States

p8yDEYe5NnKxwftkT3F_Tw.text: I FINALLY made my way to KoMex after long anticipation and boy, did it live up to its hype!   I stopped in after finding myself on "that" side of town and had luckily arrived ten minutes shy of their opening time. My guy and I sat in the car to wait until the clock struck 11. As we did, I noticed car, after car, after car pull into the parking lot. I kept eying the rearview mirror saying aloud, "I wonder if they're going to KoMex..." As I watched the first car full of people make their way towards the KoMex door, I jumped out of the car and dashed for the door (I entered first by the way).   We took our seats and browsed through the menu. While there were many items on the menu I wanted to try, we agreed that we HAD to try something off the fusion side. We decided on sharing an order of the Bulgogi fries and musubis on the side (the latter selection mainly due to the fact that I have a man from the islands). So, the place filled up within minutes of being there and while we waited, we were served homemade chips that were warm, crisp, not too salty, not too greasy. Just my style.   The fries arrived first and man, were they delicious! The mixture of flavors of everything atop the mound of goodness was perfect-- It somehow tasted as though you topped off an order of Gordon Biersch's garlic fries with perfectly cooked bulgogi. Let me tell you, it tasted better than an order of Roberto's carne asada fries after a night of intoxication. The musubis arrived shortly after and didn't disappoint. I've actually never seen them molded the way they did-- they were wider and flatter than other places usually make them.   Two things I did observe during my visit which is the only reasons why I didn't tack on that extra star: 1) As a holder of a food handler's card with lots of knowledge of food handling, I did observe one of the workers wearing the same pair of food handler's gloves the ENTIRE time I was there. The same pair was used to scoop ice, serve drinks, serve food, get items from the back, move the kitchen curtain, etc. I received a plate with a little bit of food on it as well as the drink I ordered having remnants of food that wasn't mine.  2) I should've chosen my seat differently. I sat in a position directly across from the opened gate that separates the little prep counter with the customer seating. This gave me full view of the large garbage can that I wish I hadn't had view of during my entire meal. Next time, I'll sit elsewhere.   Can't wait to return!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi fries... Yum.o!

z5jz9t37N8TsA4eP_zgxxg.text: Yum!! Love the free chips and salsa... the chips are Amazing and really thick and crispy. The salsa is kinda spicy but it's really really good.  Have enjoyed the beef bulgogi burritos, fish tacos, calimari tacos, kimchi fried rice, spam musubi.  I also saw them featured on a food show recently with Aaron Sanchez highlighting vegas food, cool!

TH1REsPgisV2IKBKcdZ5PQ.text: I'm in town often for business, so I'm always looking for the best eats off the strip. So, as usual, Yelp led me to the best. I'll admit, when I walked in I was expecting to see a menu or listing of items on the wall, or even some Komex signage inside, but instead I was stuck standing at the counter looking stupid. I wondered if I was even in the right place. It is a little hole in the wall. Nobody asked if I needed help or wanted to order. Finally, after having stood at the counter for some time I asked for a menu. Everything sounded good.  I couldn't decide on the bulgogi tacos or burrito. Naturally, I went with BOTH. And, of course I couldn't leave without the chips and guacamole. The chips were the bomb! Korean BBQ AND Mexican? Freakin GENIUS!!! Komex please make your way to San Diego!  Everything was SO good. This is definitely one of my new favorite places to eat in Vegas.

haKRbXlTqp3JY5ngLILo-A.text: I'm gaga for their bulgogi!  As their name suggests, KoMex is a Korean-Mexican fusion restaurant with a little Chinese and American thrown in for good measure. This is truly a hidden gem; although it's only a few blocks from my house, it's located in a nondescript strip mall behind a gas station, and I didn't even know it was there until I looked for nearby restaurants on Yelp. Now it's one of our go-to places for takeout (which I heartily recommend; because of its small size, you might have to wait a bit to dine indoors).  I agree with other reviewers that their bulgogi fries are fantastic, but there's one menu combination that can't be beat: the beef chow fettuccine and pork-kimchi fried rice. We usually get a full order of the fettuccine and a half order of the rice, and the portions are so big that this will serve as two hearty meals for two hearty eaters.  The beef chow fettuccine combines their signature bulgogi beef with red cabbage, onions, peppers, and carrots, all served over thick noodles. Sounds weird, but it's the best thing on the menu (IMHO). We like the fried rice with pork -- although I think any meat would be fine -- but you HAVE to add the kimchi (and its traditional fried egg partner) to give it a little extra spice. I'm not a huge kimchi fan, but it works perfectly in this combination and is especially good when you mix the fried rice and the fettuccine together. DELISH!  This time we also each ordered a chicken lettuce wrap as an appetizer. Once again, any meat combo would do in this dish. We've tried the bulgogi and the pork belly before, but today chicken won out. Chopped chicken topped with cabbage and cilantro, all wrapped up in an iceberg lettuce leaf. You can also get these as tacos (corn or flour tortillas), but the lettuce was a refreshing change from our otherwise carb-heavy meal.  Takeout service is quick and efficient, and the counter help is always friendly and appreciative when we arrive. And you can't bet the price, especially for these huge portions: $23 for two great meals for two. Thanks to the food gods for putting KoMex so close to home!

KZDrH6elb2_eLxoPIEia8A.text: This place is a pretty good fusion. Found it on yelp when we couldn't decide where to eat when we got to Vegas. The Bulgolgi fries and bibimbap was great and the grilled cheeze. I'll come here again next time I go to Vegas. When you can't decide on Asian or Mexican. This place is a good spot.

QT-6AfK6_vq0CxNAkIiKVw.text: This restaurant is in a hidden spot. You might have to wait to be seated but it will be a short wait and will be worth it. Service was good, whatever you need to know about the menu, they will explain. The bulgogi bowl was amazing. The tacos were super delicious as well. Very reasonably priced dishes.

rWd4SsUGBrzkEr6Khuxpmw.text: Friendly helpful service. The food is good. I enjoy Mexican and Korean food, so this was a fun restaurant. They did good with mixing the two.

9qyVL0GIYtoNV7p_U76wBg.text: This review is for yelper Nelson's UYE!  When I walked into the restaurant I was greeted by Nelson and other cool Yelpers.  On the table were chips/guac and egg rolls with sweet/sour sauce.  They were good, I especially enjoyed the egg/spring rolls.  For the entree I ordered a fusion chicken taco and fusion beef burrito.  What can you say, it's what I came here for.  Fusion styles it was!  My taco was piled with chicken on top of chicken and my burrito stuffed with beef!  With a splash of lime and added chile/fusion and kim chee... oooo yyyuuummmmyyyy.  Nuts gathered here!  After our entrees we were given oranges and fortune cookies!  Nice little place, great find Nelson!  Thx!

6CrKBYe98ghxAzxx8eSl6Q.text: This is more of a 3.5.  I was going to put 4 stars for the chicken fusion flautas I got but I have to take 0.5 off because I found a toothpick in it.  Apparently it was there to keep the flautas rolled and it was not taken out properly.  The manager did take off the $8 from the total of the check though.  Other than that, it seemed to be a popular place at lunch.  There was even a reserved sign on one of the back tables.

1S4f9mdvpJom_af2Zm1n7A.text: The Fries! Get the Fusion Fries!  This place was a PERFECT blend of Mexican and Asian fare. The fusion dishes are really creative and they blend together in perfect Korean-Mexican fashion. The place is not fast food, it is very high-quality food, but you still won't wait long for your meal. I think it took less than 10 minutes for all our food to come out, and we ordered a lot.  The fusion fries were my favorite, and a half order is big enough for probably 3-4 people. The pork lettuce wraps were a great appetizer, they had a little pico from the mexican side, and the meat was from the korean side. Another perfect blend. The bulgogi chimichanga was huge and delicious, and you definitely can't go wrong with this order.  I was very happy with everything I ordered and really want to go back the next time I'm in town!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi chimichanga

kJd0mJTAshNCzj0ZSsgmPw.text: I don't know what it is, but I really enjoy checking out fusion places.   I've been to KoMex a few times now. This most recent visit I brought some first-timers with me & of course I had to order the bulgogi nachos to give them a taste of this place! My friends had a fish taco, fusion enchilada plate with chicken & a fusion burrito with bulgogi. Sadly, they mixed up the meats for the burrito & enchilada. One friend got a nice surprise, the other.. not so much. Yours truly decided to order the pork belly musubi & a (yes, singular) fusion flauta. I was a little disappointed with the pork belly musubi. Two pieces took up the whole plate. I could barely hold it, so I used my fork & picked at the pieces. My fusion flauta was pretty tasty though, so I was satisfied.    I love the bulgogi nachos/fries! I'm glad that you can order half orders now. Definitely coming back when I have my next craving for them.  ..which might be soon.. :)

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The massive pork belly musubi!

GAbWr6VtP3YuY6qnHV-RPQ.text: Speechless! We now have a reason to come to Vegas! This is a small hole in the wall place in a small shopping plaza. We were kind of skeptical at first just because of the restaurant itself but we were very much surprised when the food came out. The bulgogi meat tacos were made to perfection, all the ingredients tasted amazing. It was something I had never experienced before.... I was in taco heaven! We were kind of disappointed because we were not able to try their pork tacos, they apparently were waiting for their shipment.  But next time we are in town we are definetly returning to KOMEX!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmmm delicious pork belly tacos!

lZQnpwUe7cI_nBnJFfNO2Q.text: Saw this on Taco Trip on the cooking channel. It was everything and more they said it was. We the the Torta with beef, pork tostada, and Bulgogi tater tots. So good!  Service was quick for lunch and the right price.  We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pDK41uq2tARPWwFTuqK5XA.text: I've been eyeing KoMex since summer of 2012 and I finally got to try this past trip. Better late than never.  Even though it's a bit of a drive from the strip, I am so glad we made it out (then again I wasn't the one driving... Thank you P!)  As per many yelpers' recommendation, we tried bulgogi nachos (with kimchi on the side), Fusion Flautas, and spicy pork kimchi fried rice.  I love Korean Mexican fusion. So. Good. We order the half size bulgogi nachos and that was plenty for the two of us. Their home made chips were great and they were not stingy with the toppings. I could eat this all day long. The flautas were also delicious. Bulgogi plus cheese rolled in flour tortillas and deep fried. What more could you ask? Gucamole you said? Yes, they come with the flautas and were fresh and excellent! We were really full already by the time the fried rice arrived at our table. I had a couple bites, but the flautas definitely had my heart. My friend though on the other hand couldn't stop eating the fried rice even though he was really full.  They also have 4 different kind of salsa. I only got to try 3 of them because I was too busy stuffing my face with everything else. The green one was alright. Not too memorable. But the other two that I tried were amazing. One of them kind of remind me of the sauce Kogi truck uses. It has a nice balance of vinegary and spiciness, except the one here has an extra kick at the end. The kick at the end is pretty strong. The other one is on the sweet side, and if I could I would steal their salsa home. Remember to grab the salsa containers when your complementary tortilla chips arrived!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fusion Flautas
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi nachos! Half of an order is plenty for 2~3 as an appetizer
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complementary chips and salsa and guac!

u82QohTjNILGbw1OE7IDcw.text: Great place if you want some bulgogi stuffed inside a torta or burrito! The (I'm assuming) owner was all hands on. He took our orders, cooked the food, served it to us, and bid us farewell. The food was cooked to order, so our cheese steak and torta came out pipping hot and juicy! It was loaded with meat, and the torta was jammed pack with Mexican and Korean flavor. The only complaint that I had was with the musubi; it was jammed packed with rice with a thinly sliced piece of spam on the top. Make it smaller, cut out some of the rice, and a slightly thicker slice of spam, and you could still sell it for $4.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gooey cheese steak!

T7LV05Q5wQlJsdRKsEYSqA.text: Amazing amazing amazing. I cannot get enough of this place. I usually come here 1 every two weeks. The lettuce wraps are by far my favorite.

Z2WjVVljOxZ_89uX5nZzTA.text: Great hole in the wall, stopped here because my work opened a new location nearby and nobody knew where to go for lunch. I trust the yelp nation and the reviews looked positive. I ordered a two item plate which was really more cod than I needed but I am a big guy so that's not a complaint. I had a Korean bbq meat - can't really remember how to spell it but bogoli(?) which was awesome along with veggies and white rice. The flavor of the meat was excellent and the veggies were cooked perfectly, not too crisp but not too soggy. Service was a little slow but food is made to order so again a good thing. Parking is limited at lunch time when I came in all the more reason to get in a little early. I am not sure when I will be back in Vegas again but will try something different here next time.

uuK7D0yJ2ZREjBS9a_LzxA.text: Otw to Komex both my boys decided to take a nap. So we had to change our plans which is fine.  My wife and I decided to order Togo and eat it at her parents house.   First time ordering pork belly musubi but we always order kimchi fried rice, bulgogi nachos, combo fried rice, 2 orders of chicken wings and beef chowfun.  I didn't eat breakfast that day for some reason so I was starving. My wife started driving and I wanted to try the pork belly musubi. My first bite was heavenly. I'm so glad I ordered it but I should of ordered orders instead of 1. But one order came with 2 so it's plenty.  I first tasted the crispy fried smokey of the pork belly and it was out of this world.  It lasted about 8 minutes. My wife took a couple bites but I pretty much inhaled it. I'm gonna try it with egg next time.  The kimchi fried rice, chow fun, bulgogi nachos, 2orders of chicken wings, and regular fried rice for the kids is our goto order every time we go. Sometimes we mix in bulgogi tacos or sliders. But everything ever thing is good including the Chinese side of the menu. The wonton soup is excellent and chow fun. I have not been disappointed with the the food.  Even if we drove 25 minutes the bulgogi nachos were so tasty. If you ever had chilequiles, it reminded me of that with a twist.  I will be back, I have family in town so hopefully this week. My sisters first choice is always Komex and they drove 500 miles vegas! Thank you Komex.  Everything is subjective,  and I am not picky but I enjoy komex. Service is always excellent! !!

UKbZAWReoxdEPIPYpESbng.text: Best place so far in Las Vegas!!!! Has the most AMAZING fried rice I've ever had in my life!!! Customer service was just as amazing as the food. I HIGHLY recommend going here if you're ever in Vegas. It's a hidden gem

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ydHKByncWJP660tT3wUIDA.text: Surprisingly super bomb spot in the middle of nowhere. Korean fusion food. The kimchi fried rice is spicer than the usual so beware, bomb regardless!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kimchi fried rice

93qT90XPdWLg49X3XlZzHg.text: I really wanted to love this place but it was not meant to be. In all honesty, I think there is just better fusion food in LA where I am from. We tried the pork belly musubi (good but would be better if the pork belly was cut into smaller pieces), the kimchi fried rice (Monta's is better), and the famous bulgogi fries. I think the fries need to be crunchier because it became soggy underneath everything. All the toppings were good but it just felt like something was missing. I would also suggest getting the kimchi on the side because that made everything soggy real quick.   All in all, not a rave-worthy place to visit...

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iZN_xxw682PpdyqTeP-b9Q.text: Wow... Amazing!...  A hole in the wall and it's amazing! It does look a little.. cheap.. but the food and customer service is extraordinary. I couldn't complain about one thing so far.

TXxS92owlO9Hl7qoZkIW0w.text: Shockingly Decent,  This place is an obvious hole in the wall kitchen eatery type joint. Meats are cooked and seasoned nicely. Rice is kept nicely steamed. Prices are reasonable. Lousy Location, little hard to find because its dark.  Thier kimchi could be better, and when you're done eating.   Throw it out immediately, because Korean spices spoil easily and smell super foul.  So eat it and trash it right away.

549amvTWTIO8Wf-zm7dU6w.text: So we found this local joint on Yelp, and had to give them a whirl since we had a great Asian/Mexican fusion experience at Korilla in NYC.  We actually went twice just to make sure we gave them a far shake.  Unfortunately, though good, we've had better.  The beef was too salty both times, and the veggies were pretty few compared to the carbs when we opted to go healthier the second time   However, the Pork belly Mitsubi was unlike anything we've ever had... a must experience.  Sadly, we really wanted to like this place... but would still recommend and have you decide for yourself.

Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BAJ_ZB1oGaGV_jQgoMUaZw.text: KoMex was recommended by a friend as a good place to eat out off the Las Vegas strip and you get the most bang for your buck (I would say cheap, but that word negative connotations). The food is delicious and the portions are huge! During non busy times they serve food fast and is made to order! I can't wait to eat here again and would definitely recommend to anyone that is hungry on a budget!

P-foysMy1DVpgVZ_ciazlQ.text: The food is amazing! Cooked fresh to order, and service by the cook/owner (I assume) was spot on.  Sauces and salsas we all fresh and a tasty addition to the sliders, burritos, and enchiladas we tried.  It's like an awesome food truck but indoors.

aCzz6HSYYnPujJ5oV4tsSQ.text: One word, WOW !!! My friends and I were searching for a place to eat as we drove back from the Grand Canyon. We came across this place but it  was closing in 45 minutes so we rushed! When we got there the gentleman in the front quickly acknowledged us and found us seats!! He was soooooo nice!! ( I don't know if he was also the owner ) but seriously he was on top of things. We ordered our food and it came out so quickly !! The food was so yummy. All my friends enjoyed their meals!! The prices are verrrryyy reasonable as well! You get 5% off your check when you pay with cash! :)  I ordered the philly steak

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HMspiNFZXnaFqYx58oJHhw.text: We love fusion! It doesn't get more Fusion than these tacos and burritos. He had bulgogi beef burrito and chicken taco in corn tortilla. Loved! And he doesn't like dark meat. He also had bulgogi rice bowl-living outside the box-didn't like. No judgement against the restaurant though.   I had lettuce wrapped beef tacos. Awesome!! He ordered the beef burrito but I ate most of it. This was the best thing here! I also tried the beef fettuccine-not my thing. No judgement. Worth a visit for tacos and burritos!!

Wv5VDrXVj0nbmSg9vvkHyQ.text: Pretty good fusion place. I usually stay clear of fusion place but Korean Mexican interested me.  I got the tostada with pork. Pretty unique.  It was a rice cake topped with spicy pork and in house slaw. It wasn't too big so you won't become crazy full with it.  Wife got the standard bulgulgi which was tasty.  Wife got the pork belly masubi. Belly was salty which was wrapped around rice. It worked pretty nice. I would go back.

Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly masubi
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tostada with pork. Interesting presentation.

GpDehQSqEqcLZR3sohBQ2A.text: One of my favorite local hole in the walls. We always get the fusion fries with spicy pork and sweet chili sauce. One order costs $8 and easily feeds two. Want to try other dishe, but the fries are so good!

WtWf1yvb99x8_jlIUsnplA.text: Not big on leaving reviews since I think you should figure out on your own whether you like a restaurant or not.  But you're doing yourself a disservice by not coming here. This place is turning out GREAT food

pTZvtwVlgBl3oyt66qrQzA.text: Freaking goooood. I love Korean food! This place was fresh and their bimbimbop was legit. It's not a fancy place but the stuff was delicious.

rX3BBl9IQrSr0E2ITYHCvQ.text: After wanting to try this place, we finally got take-out saturday for lunch. Located opposite the car dealership (high school and golf course are other markers for the same side of the car dealership). You might miss it because it's in a little corner of a little strip-mall on the same side as the VCA animal hospital.   I chose the full plate of mixed fried rice- chicken, beef, & shrimp (so I could share it with my son) while my husband got the beef burrito. I had my rice with the hot sauce and it was quite tasty. The meats were very good. The beef was especially tender and sliced thin. The veggies were cooked perfectly. I guess the only thing that would likely ruin fried rice is if the rice were mushy; but no issues here. My son liked it too; I just had to cut the chicken into smaller pieces. My husband didn't think it was anything special- I had a bite of his burrito and it was pretty good to me (but I suspect he was comparing it to Truk-n-yaki). I really liked the fried rice, but I saw so many things I'd try in the future, like the nachos, torta, or the kimchi fried rice. If we were to go to the Meadows Mall in the morning, I could see getting take-out from here again.  The vast menu is split between fusion and mexican. I wanted fusion, but that's me. Hubby said that there was a huge sign on the wall, stating "items are made to order." He described the inside as being larger than a hole-in-a-wall and noted there were a couple customers inside dining. The korean man at the register highly suggested the tacos and burritos for a first-timer. And hubby loves burritos.   Like I said, I wanna try other items on the menu. So, we'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hubby&#39;s Burrito
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Rice, mmm

PGIBskQxdTYnZ_lRe4tjHA.text: Came here on a Saturday morning right before hitting the popular Vegas day beach clubs. We were greeted by a very friendly man who explained the whole menu for us and the different options we had when ordering. I don't recall his name but he was very attentive of us and made sure we enjoyed the Ko-Mex experience.  We had the kimchi fried rice with tofu, bulgogi fries, fish tacos, and the winner of our meal: tater tots with bulgogi! Ala carte, the kimchi fried rice and fish tacos were good. Not great, but good. They have two house sauces - one of which, the sweeter one - brought everything together when added to the meals, bringing my aforementioned "good" up to a wonderful! I didn't get to try the other house sauce, which they explained was spicier than the one we had, but again I can't make it past a level 4 on the spiciness scale. The tater tots were just amazing, both with and without the house sauce.  Tip: 5% off if you pay with cash!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tater tots AKA Heaven in the cast iron skillet, kimchi fried rice, bulgogi fries, and tacos!

LAaPtAhKWySXI1RoNnUBxA.text: I have now been eating at Komex pretty frequently for about five years and I am still on the first page of the menu :( I need more friends or I need to just buck up and order everything to go so I can try it all.  I checked on the menu and so far I have had: Fusion Taco Fusion Burrito Fusion Flautas  Fusion Nachos Fusion Quesadilla Fusion Sliders KoMex Slaw Bulgogi Fried Rice  Fusion tacos: Beef is my absolute favorite, pork belly second, calamari third and chicken fourth. I can usually finish three tacos when at the restaurant and be fine without that super stuffed feeling. Or if I get something else it's usually entree (in this case flautas) + one taco. Two tacos plus something else for one person is really pushing it. Bring someone with you and share!  Fusion tacos an the flautas are by far my favorite.  I always get the San Pellegrino Blood Orange for my drink to wash everything down. :)  I have been to the second location as well (much closer to my house) but the original is my favorite just for nostalgia. Service is always awesome at both.

ea7Ms05PUYXGRGXAYav-pA.text: A Las Vegas favorite for myself and coworkers!  At least one visit to this place is in order every time we are staying in or passing through Vegas.  If you are looking for fresh food that has an unexpected twist on two great food styles, then look no further.  Meals are made to order, and If you are not absolutely starving you should stick with the half orders.  I think i have had just about everything off the menu now, and I haven't been disappointed.  Great value for fresh prepared food and the flavors are on point.  As long as they are around, I'll always be back!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half order of kimchi fried rice
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi beef nachos/fries

KhMLLla5XuaprIxHV4KoLQ.text: I've been to this place twice, this location and the one on Buffalo and it's safe to say I am a huge fan. The menu is filled with a variety of fusion dishes or single items from Mexican or Korean. My favorites are the fusion carne asada fries, flautas, and quesadillas. Plus, the portion are generous. Price is moderate. And service is exceptional.   I'll have to try other options next time I come here.

Jd_FkrGXJOzelMUIMEmYNw.text: This is my 1st time being they're very horrible experience. There customer service the man and young lady there are very rude.the food was OK I asked for another sauce they told me that they had to purchase it by the pound I only wanted one more cup. 1 little cup of sauce and they try to sell me a pound a sause at least sell the little cup for a quarter like McDonald's but a pound of sause never again and please don't waist your time or your money food isn't that great

-_8CaR3vz8iTt6zoXLvH8g.text: Love it, love it, love it.   A Las Vegas gem.   Restaurants like Komex make it so there is no need to go to the strip. If you don't like hole-in-the-walls you better go anyway.  You will miss out. Thanks guys!

9Vi37ldG5ogKAHIf19qEqA.text: first. black people are naturally skeptical..past that and get here .. fast... also skip the pork. it kills.. lol...everything else #bomb.com

FXSQewFGvjVYAp793XyDSA.text: This place is A-OK for me. Komex is generally a spot I visit when I specifically have the craving, but I feel like the quality has gone down significantly since they opened. The last 3 times I visited, the meat was bland and chewy. I also use to love the kim chi fried rice because it wasn't overly sour like some other places. The last 2 times I ordered it, it tasted bland and old. Even prior to those past visits, I still would've rated this place 3 stars.     So what's up with the 2 stars? Well, we stopped in last week and tried to use Samsung Pay. I get it, it's still new so people are not familiar with it. The problem came when the owner refused to try it and began arguing with my boyfriend. I get that you don't want to use it, totally fine, but why put up such an argument. He could've just said no and asked for another form of payment rather than immediately making an issue out of it. I've always has such a pleasant experience with the owners in the past that this reaction was extremely off putting. Needless to say, we wont be back.

_z-9QQemDfSQHyi2Y3W__w.text: This place lives up to its reputation!  This evening, we tried 3 menu items at the Decatur location:  The Bulgogi enchiladas, seafood tacos, and Bulgogi cheesesteak (mozzarella and provolone; onions and peppers).  We all were pleasantly surprised by the house salsas and sauces, but the Bulgogi meat was easily the best part of our meal!  Everything was perfectly seasoned, piping hot, and delicious.  The fried food was good, but not as exciting as their non-fried items.  Portion sizes are adequate to generous, and pricing reflects this.  As amazing as the food was, the experience was really enhanced by the service we received tonight.  Ken was our server and explained several nuances of the dishes which newcomers will appreciate.  We felt that the staff was truly passionate about what was being served and sought absolute customer satisfaction.  (TIP:  Pay in cash and get 5% off your order total!)  This is definitely not a place to dress up for (very potent aromas will stay with you for a while), but the food and service were excellent!  If you're looking for affordable and exceptional fusion cuisine, KoMex is a must!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood tacos.  (Appetizer with house pico de gallo in background.)
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The seafood tacos were very generous.
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi enchiladas were a favorite!  The meat is slightly sweet, but remarkably suited for the pairings.

GqOfCFoYPjhmzCsgwSRfMw.text: Perfect mix of Korean and Mexican fusion. We ordered many items to sample and share.   First we ordered the Beef Tostada.  It was a nice mix of Korean (the crispy rice and beef bulgogi) and Mexican (cabbage and salsa).   Next, we had the Chicken Nachos.  This dish was delicious and probably the favorite dish of the night. Layered with cheese, perfectly seasoned chicken, tomatoes and jalapenoes this dish is a must try!  One member of our group ordered the Spicy Pork Quesadilla, while another ordered the Kim Chee Fried Rice. The fried rice was spicy but delicious.   I ordered the Chicken Chow Fettucine.  It was nice, but not my favorite dish of the night.   Overall I would return. Staff is friendly, there's a lot of parking and reasonable prices.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kim Chee Fried Rice
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Chow Fettuccine
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Pork Quesadilla

UwYTbQUJsicxg25nYlpnOQ.text: I had the fusion bulgogi cheese steak sandwich. It was steaming hot and full of tons on cheese... too much cheese and I love cheese!!! A little underwhelming in the seasoning. All I really tasted was bread cheese and bland steak. Won't be back.

Fx4NrFHc0-PUZ6Mf8u-B1Q.text: Komex is awsome guys!  Definately a hole in the wall place but once u step inside u see why it's followers are always coming by. The food is fresh from the smallest detail and the service is beyond expectations! The staff is awsome, they have a wide variety of fusion foods that are awsome, I personally am a huge fan of they're tater tots and teriyaki chicken, u get chips and salsa for the wait and when ur food comes it's a sight to see!

-_MgDEM5tWlKNq5EwdxIrQ.text: Glad this place was close by, I had the bulgogi cheese steak and a calamari taco. It was more than enough, the food was delicious and fresh. I liked the family vibe and the hard working owner being around. If you like a casual atmosphere, good service and great food, make sure to come here.

7WyfK4rJfakwhKNH65deCw.text: Korean food an Mexican food are some of my FAVORITE cuisines for well seasoned meat! I LOVE Bulgogi and was craving a Torta. So glad this combination exists. I had one Pork taco, which was good. Nothing too great but still good, went well with the sweet Korean sauce that was on the table. I also ordered the Bulgogi torta which was SOOOO crazy good. I could not stop raving about it. Again, went so well with the sweet Korea sauce. The prices were a tad bit high for just the Torta, would've been great if it came with a small side, but it does fill you up. Service was a bit slow since we had to wait a few minutes just to be offered water but it was busy considering there was only 1 person in the front handling the orders and tables. I would totally come back and perhaps try something new.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wuKB8QveM_YU6edWEpDIvA.text: This place was so delicious. Every single bite was an intense explosion of flavor.   I ordered the wings, bulgogi chimichanga and kimchi fried rice. I loved them all. The portions were huge so we had plenty of leftovers for dinner.   If I had to choose one, it would be the Bulgogi chimichanga. I can't even begin to describe the flavor but it's bulgogi in a burrito style chimichanga that is just so perfectly created. It's massive in proportion so you can share it with a couple of people.   Will definitely return here.

1lq7LHedOTbPYsyZScTNiA.text: This is a local favorite!  Absolutely best kept secret off the strip.  Don't miss the Fusion Chimichanga!

uk6nQIUIYjvDqk2umbI3GQ.text: This is my favorite fusion Restaurant. It's good food any day . I go for the lettuce wraps & tacos . If i go with other people i try other things to spilt . Clean place & Manager is on top of everything .

lblN0gxQWNW3wt9kmdrnuw.text: I was really excited to try this place but was a little disappointed. I was expecting really flavorful food but the salsas and meat didn't have the bang I was looking for. I went twice and tried the burrito, the tacos and the bulgogi tostada. It was okay but nothing too impressive

Lc8L_IRxV3qeMWIOrvgrtQ.text: Our family loves KoMex! Somehow our trip this past week was the first time my husband has gone-a travesty!  On this visit I did two adobo and two pollo Mexican tacos. So good! I also stole a few bites of my brother's chicken teriyaki. Mom got some wontons for the table to share. That wonton sauce is ridiculous so good. Sweet and sticky-seriously perfect. The hubs did a few Mexican tacos and a quesadilla, and he ate every bite. All around it was an awesome meal for the whole family, and their service is always great. We have been coming here for years and have never had a bad experience. Highly recommend this place!

F81wb0PsnkXMHKSA-1TtRg.text: Awesome place! Love the nachos and enchiladas. Everything is great here. Repeat customer!

C5M7R2mI4Et7XY2KQkew7w.text: Great Mexican-Korean fusion food, and some American classics like philly cheesesteak with a Korean touch. We tried the Fusion Bulgogi cheesesteak sandwich and Fusion fries; tasty and generous servings. Your order might take some time before it's ready (a large sign stating that all dishes are made to order explains it), but it's worth the wait. Friendly service, good food and great value.

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fusion fries with fried eggs (additional)
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fusion Bulgogi cheesesteak

2UgcgO6iVqJgRs5y39NEZg.text: Korean and Mexican WHATTTT??? Wow there is something to be said about Fusion Food. We stopped at this place when a friend jumped on Yelp and saw the fab reviews.  It is in a strip mall with tight parking but so worth the extra effort and time.  So inexpensive especially in a town where I am always shocked at the cost of Mexican Food. I had the fusion tacos and they were delish!  Love finding little gems like this.  It's a place worth driving to and checking out. You will not be disappointed. If you are picky on ambiance take it go.  Geez this review is making me want to take a trip back to KoMex as we speak : )  Did I mention just saw they opened another location on Flamingo/Buffalo woot woot!

G0p4H-tXx7pFcWP5bhh3_Q.text: Visiting fr CA, happy they took reservation as I was meeting up w/local friends who had never been here and heard it was hard to get in cuz its always so busy. Table was ready half hr before I arrived per one friend who arrived early.  Service was outstanding. Food was delicious as the bulgogi was marinated perfectly and tender.   We shared  everything bulgogi: PBBBLT,  nachos, rice bowl, rice plate, as well as spam kimchi fried  rice and musubis.  The iced tea was a plus!  I need to go back and try the chimichanga and burrito.  If you like bulgogi with a mexican twist... Komex is the place!

photos.caption: Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. special friends in a special place
Photo of KoMex Fusion - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bulgogi rice bowl, spam kimchi fried rice, spam musubi, PBBBLT (pork belly, bulgogi BLT), bulgogi plate, bulgogi nachos

JxdWM3NjfevQd_4K6M4RRg.text: Compared to the KorMex Fusion restaurant Vatos Tacos in SOUTH KOREA, I came here with high expectations after falling in love with Korean Mexican fusion food. However, KoMex here in Las Vegas did NOT live up to its potential.   The areas I rated that lead me to the 3 Star rating was first the food, the menu selection and the ambiance of the restaurant.   The food was a hard 3 stars. The bulgogi fries were made with what looked and tasted like Grocery Store frozen thick cut fries then topped with block cheese that just hardened if not eaten right away when hot.  The Kimchi Fried rice tastes good at first but quickly looses its appeal after about four bites leaving you with a bland plain taste that makes you wish there was something to smack your taste buds out of your mouth.  I ordered the Fusion Chimichanga which was a disaster. Waaaay too much vegetables on top of the mess and little flavor on the inside to keep you going for more.   With dishes that were presented to look good the flavor was subpar. But it was ok if it's your first time trying Korean Mexican fusion however I will say this is MORE MEXICAN than Korean.   The menu selection is basically a Mexican food menu with Bulgogi and other Korean meats to choose from.  And compared to Vatos Tacos in South Korea where the restaurant shows elegance as well as style and class right when you walk in the door inviting you to not only come back for dinner but also bring a date, this KoMex restaurant seemed like the place you take your 4 person family or group to when you honestly just don't want Taco Bell and want to "spice" your lunch up for the day.   Solid 3 stars. Would have given it 2.5 but I don't know how to do that on yelp.

EFiLNjwY8087WKFWgNLt0w.text: Tried a few things. Everything was very good and reasonably priced. We got 2 entrees, 1 taco, side of guac, chips + salsa for $25. It was still more than enough food that we ended up taking the rest home. The customer service was really good too! It was also fun to try out all their salsas. Bomb!

kfH-oFBP_ae_js6lSxqvQg.text: First time going off the strip to go eat dinner. Very interesting mix of Korean food and Mexican food. I guess it works . I tried their fusion Flautas. First time every trying it but hey!~~~ it was pretty good. My friend told me its just usually just cheese and no meat but they added bul gogi meat in it. Pretty good~!   Service was good. Everyone's really nice and helpful.

pQUClWmBuFmqwiU29KLsKw.text: We stopped for a quick dinner at Komex before a show around 6pm on a Tuesday. Surprisingly we were the only ones eating while we were there. The comp tortilla chips were freshly made and we ordered a variety of their fusion bulgogi Beef & chicken tacos while my wife also had  calamari & shrimp lettuce wrap.  You can taste the High quality ingredients used but adding their sweet sauce on the tacos made everything taste much more amazing. Depending on meat choice prices range $2-3 per taco, we wanted to stay and order more but we will definitely plan to return when in Vegas again!

fq-VzxtCcJxKOvbfu3bp9Q.text: Great service! Great delicious food! The Bulgogi Tater Tots, Korean style Buffalo Chicken Wings, and Bulgogi Flautas were awesome. Parking may be a challenge but we lucked out this time. Definitely will come back whenever when we are in the area!
